Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: miss-zwatanika
Reviews.Content: Good food, good beds,nice people, lovely restaurant, free wifi, late check-out. Tv is tiny and nailed to the wall!Breakfast buffet was super good, in the evening there was a clybby vibe in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Bit hipsterish but good!”
Reviews.Author: rarabug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the loft rooms last November for 4 nights. The hotel is very cool and had a lovely laid back feeling. The room was pretty nice and big for how reasonable it was- although the quality of some of the fittings weren't amazing it was clean and had some really nice design features. (Actually the entire hotel has some really nice design!) It's right beside the U-Bhan and really easy to get to. Situated in the middle between city centre and arty Kreuzberg. Breakfast is a bit pricey but worth it. The only negative was that the cleaners left the window open 2 days in a row in our room. So after being out all day in the freezing cold we got back to an ice box of a room! But once I complained they apologised and offered us a chocolate mit rum! Overall it was a great hotel-good fun (bar stays open pretty much all night) and I would recommend it to other couples and groups, probably not families with very young children though. It is a bit of a hispster hang out but sure it just made for a more entertaining stay!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Cool, funky, arty, atmospheric hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank P
Reviews.Content: Was only here one night, but the place feels special from the moment you walk in. Staff were all extremely friendly and when we decided to chill for breakfast or some drinks we met lots of fellow travelers. Rooms were clean and cozy. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for something a little different.

Reviews.Title: “You have no right to call yourself a "hipster" until these 2 things happen:”
Reviews.Author: the_real_bohemian
Reviews.Content: 1. you visit/move to Berlin 2. you stay at/hang out at the Michelberger. Just call this place the hipster mothership. OH I forgot - hipsters would never call themselves hipsters. OH so sorry. Well if the shoe fits... Myself - I most, absolutely, do not fit into that category, however I do love me a fancy, not trying to look fussy designer hotel so when I landed in Berlin the Michelberger was the only option. I mean look at their front entrance. How could you not love a place that welcomes you with "New S**T Has Come to Light"? OK so to be serious for a minute here are my thoughts on the Michelberger as a hotel. 1. Good location more or less. Across the street from a subway and down the street from the train that connects you to the main station (prob. 15 mins). 2. Daytime staff is cool. and friendly. Of course they are international hipsters. Hipsters speaking English, German, Italian, Spanish, Hungarian, etc... take your pick. The overnight staff however is this decidedly "not cool" older dude (who only speaks German) prob cause all the cool kids are hung over from some "art pahtee". 3. The "cozy" room is compact and has all you need. Most important the queen bed is nice and firm (and could be quite kinky if you have 3) with a view of your showering buddy for those into that kinda thing. 4. WiFi is free and fast. 5. the place is hopping! There is a restaurant and cafe and bar. IMPORTANT!!!! If you want to actually sleep make sure to get a room that is NOT facing the courtyard as there are people partying there until 4am. If you plan on joining them - never mind. 6. Finally the breakfast buffet (not free) is actually one of the best hotel breakfast buffets I've seen in a very long time. Lots of choice and very delicious. Also the people watching in the morning is quite the riot - I lost count of the ironic T's, arty giant glasses, etc... Have I mentioned that the staff here are more friendly than you have the right to expect them to be? I was half expecting to hate this place but ended up liking it in spite of the trendiness. So take what I have said under advisement and just stay here already!

Reviews.Title: “Really cool place”
Reviews.Author: nathalieyes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Michelberger in march and really like the hotel. It funky and cool, without being "cold", lovely staff, a fantastic breakfast buffet and loads of "small things" that make it a great place that you'll remember, and not only a 08/15 hotel that is fine, but wont stick out. The courtyard is lovely, and must be a great place to spend an evening in summer. Cool and trendy decoration all over the public areas and the rooms, with a lot of small details. I had a band room (that would easily fit 5 people) for myself. Comfy beds (two of them in the "loft"), and I l really like the "book / paper theme" that is all over the hotel. The hotel is just opposite the Warschauer Strasse U and S-Bahn station, from where you can pretty much reach every place in Berlin. Around the hotel, you wont find a lot of restaurants that are within walking distance, and thats probably the only reason why on my next trip to Berlin, I will think about going back there.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jpi74
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel to stay in Berlin which has good transport links this is the one. Quirky rooms, great breakfast, good bar. Been coming back to this one again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place!”
Reviews.Author: dailali
Reviews.Content: It's hard to describe how cool is this place! Everything is so perfectly designed...and the atmosphere is captivating. I strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice and trendy experience in Berlin. I'll definitely come back one day...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveller01
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived the atmosphere at the hotel was captivating - a world away from the usual type of anonymous corporate hotel. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help us with whatever questions we had; every thing was given the michelberger touch from the funny room key, and the special breakfast tokens to the small family type photos next to the bed. Free and fast wi-fi everywhere in the hotel was a great bonus too. My room was quite small and fairly basic but had everything I needed and was quiet. There are lots of spaces to sit and relax lots of sofas in the lobby area, seating in the large courtyard and a bright and airy restaurant. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel they are in the city they are visiting

Reviews.Title: “A hotel adventure with endless treats!”
Reviews.Author: Duncan_Bramwell
Reviews.Content: Stay at Michelberger during business trip to Berlin. I'm a consultant in the hotel business, so think of me of the most demanding and picky guest! This hotel was a treat to the senses and the wallet. They've captivated the feeling of Berlin in this hotel and you feel like a friend in your best friend's home. Forget the big boring brands, and treat yourself to something really fun and refreshing! A great job, well done!

Reviews.Title: “A cool and relaxed hotel that is pleasantly different”
Reviews.Author: Dennis L
Reviews.Content: This hotel avoids being a traditional fusty hotel and it is staffed by enthusiastic and helpful young people. The bar is (I think) open 24 hours a day, and is usually busy with a young crowd, and there is usually music playing. It is a good place to flop on one of the many sofas after a day visiting Berlin. Our room had a sort of d-i-y aesthetic. The bed was very comfortable and was on a raised platform accessible by a ladder. I had no problem with that. There was a TV but no refridgerator. The buffet breakfast, served until 11am, is excellent. The street outside is not especially pretty, but two tram services stop outside and S and U Bahn stations are less than 300m away. We paid €306 for a couple for three nights, including breakfast (early March 2012). I recommend this hotel and would love to to back.

Reviews.Title: “Not too cool for grandparents - or so they told us!”
Reviews.Author: andrew w
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not disappoint. In initially walking in through the bar area it certainly appeared to live up to its "trendy" label. The lobby layout is creatively arranged and comfortable and the whole place was buzzing with the 20/30s crowd. We felt so old that I asked the receptionist if grey hair was allowed or if I needed to dye my hair! I was assured that they loved having grandparents! Certainly we were warmly welcomed. The corridors are dark, gloomy and evocative, I imagine, of communist days. The room, however, although small, was beautifully clean, very well laid out, comfortable and very quiet. The area around the hotel has a slightly run-down feel but transport links are superb. The breakfast was no doubt excellent but too expensive for those of us happy with a coffee and a cake at a cheaper establishment. This was a great base, thoroughly recommended - even by this grandad!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfortable, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: TS2010
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal place to stay to see Berlin. WIth the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and tram on the doorstep there are really easy connections to all of the city. The Michelberger is a great hotel with a really friendly feel to it. We had a loft room, which was a good size for two but easily could have slept three people. It was warm, comfortable and had lovely big windows, luckily double-glazed the hotel is on a busy road. There was a tv and some interesting decor/furniture, including rope shelving and a ladder up to the mezzanine sleeping area. There were not many extras to the room (no kettle, iron, etc) but these seemed to be available at the reception, and it was nice to have spacious room that was lofty and uncluttered. Shower gel and a big bottle of water were included with the room. The bathroom was small and en suite. The shower was good but the bathroom was dimly-lit and separated from the main bedroom by a frosted glass window - private but not completely so! It is definitely worth paying the extra for breakfast - it is served in the restaurant downstairs and there is plenty of choice - cereal, breads, pastries, eggs, meat, cheese, fruit and lots of teas and juices as well as coffee. It's also served until 11am in the week and 12 noon at weekends so no early starts necessary. The bar downstairs serves good coffee, fresh cakes and pretzels and very scrumptious hot chocolate. The guy with the beard behind the bar mixes a mean margerita too. There's a really friendly party feeling in the evenings, and a good mix of random pop from the 80s and 90s was played on Friday night. By day it's more like a coffee shop or a common room and provides a nice place to hang out. It's not somewhere to stay if you want a standard generic hotel - this is for people who want a bit of character and something that's a bit more like a hostel but without the budget feel. It's also for people who don't mind a bit of noise from the other rooms when other guests get home after a night out. The hotel has some of the biggest warehouse clubs nearby and some clearly come here to party. But don't think this is just for young people; there was a really good mix of ages and nationalities and the atmosphere is very relaxed and welcoming. The staff are brilliant - speak perfect English, always very helpful and genuinely seem to like working there. We asked for information about travel to the aiport and got a bespoke printout with timings, platform numbers and clear instructions - so helpful! All in all, a great base from which to explore Berlin and a really refreshing great change from a regular chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place if you are looking for something different....”
Reviews.Author: sambo06
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 4 nights stay, it does live up to the good reviews. The location is fab, couldnt be better and we faced directly onto the street and had no problems with noise at all. The design of the rooms and the reception, lobby, bar and chill out area is very clever, so quirky, edgy - you definately will remember your stay here. Only reason I wouldnt give it 5 stars, is that a couple of wee things, could have bumped it up the ratings for us....an ipod docking station or even a radio in the rooms would have been just perfect and breakfast at €11 is pricey....especially when you can nip down the road to Simon Dach Strasse for some good berliner grub! All in all, a very memorable place.....will certainly recommend it! P.S Remember to visit the Badeschiff on your visit, a pool / sauna facility on the river spree!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but stylish with an amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: katwoma
Reviews.Content: This is my first review whilst on a ten week trot around the globe. I'll keep it succinct because I like getting to the point. The Michelberger is fantastic. Funky rooms, cleaned daily, no shampoo/lotions etc included. You have to request a hair dryer at reception. Very, very helpful staff, sweet bar, cool vibe, chilled. Breakfast was amazing. U-Bahn was right out front. Location brilliant. Highly reccomend you test this place out.

Reviews.Title: “great price for designer hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTaraPoppy
Reviews.Content: We loved it, v stylish, great food, fab rooms, lovely staff, would recommend to anyone staying in Berlin. AMAZING BREAKFAST!

Reviews.Title: “Coolest crib in town”
Reviews.Author: PyynikinParoni
Reviews.Content: Super original, super cool! Good service, excellent breakfast (+reasonably priced), great decor and after a long day in Berlin you walk into a party every night in the lobby bar. U-bahn station literally across the street! Nice restaurants within a walking distance. By far the coolest hotel experience I´ve ever had. Booked another stay the day after departure... And yes, this is for the urban hipsters, not for the golden oldies.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen_Tim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Michelberger for 7 days and had a great time. The room was small but cosy and clean, just what we wanted. Staff was very friendly and the location was perfect with the U & S bahn in front of the hotel. Great overall atmosphere! Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 13th to 15th Jan to celebrate my birthday! Rooms are so stylish and cosy i stayed in a nice and spacious loft room with my friend. I would highly recommend this hotel along with the alternative walking tour which picks you up at the hotel. Ben who is the guide is very well informed on Berlin and shows you a side of it which I just would not have seen had i explored it myself during the time I was there. I hope to come back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Overall amazing experience michel berger stylee!”
Reviews.Author: vickyenglish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 30 th dec till 2nd jan for my boyfriends xmas present, we stayed in a cozy room with a sexy shower! Brilliant to watch your partner having a shower from your bed! Really quirky room with lots of character just like the rest of the hotel! The 1st night we had a 5 course meal which was lovely home cooked food very generous portions! Loved the whole vibe off the hotel from the vintage cases and cuckoo clocks in reception, too the classic soul music played by the dj! All staff spoke brilliant english two members of staff that were very helpful were inga and phillip! Any problems see these guys on reception they couldn't be more helpful! Will defineatly coming back see you all soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Huge fun and superb service”
Reviews.Author: Charles R
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is a superb mixture of whackiness, unusual rooms, relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff and slick service. Pretty well everything has been really well thought through, and our large party (17 to 55 years old) were all thrilled. The rooms are unusual, inspiring and very comfortable: the setting huge fun; the seating area and bar superb; and the location terrific for walking, S-bahn and U-bahn. Everyone should swim at the Badeschiff (15 minutes away). Wi-fi is excellent. Our only regret was a slightly expensive breakfast: otherwise, the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended: Modern, clean, cleverly designed, hip, trendy and young hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karslima
Reviews.Content: I had initial reservations booking a room at the Michelberger but I'm glad that my husband and I decided to give it a try and stay there. We will certainly be back and would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an easily accessible location in Berlin and a good base for exploring the city/ sightseeing (especially for those in the city for the first time). There are so many "uber-hip and trendy hotels" in the world's major cities that just disappoint and fall short of expectations. In some cases, the staff are too hip to care or nothing properly works in the rooms. I'm glad my initial concerns about the Michelberger were proven wrong. The pros: Friendly and helpful staff who efficiently checked us in when we arrived in the morning and out. A hearty breakfast with hot and cold food options (and sufficient choices for vegetarians as well). Daily housekeeping service and the room was always kept clean. There is a restaurant/bar right by the hotel's reception area where they sometimes have live music (Not sure what the food is like in the restaurant/bar because we didn't get a chance to eat there but they have a good cocktail and wine list). I really liked (and appreciated) the modern aesthetic of the place and the smart use of space in the common areas and bedrooms. Even though the hotel has a very modern feel it wasn't cold or uninviting. The cons: The internet connection (although free) was very spotty and slow in the room and even in the common areas. It only worked 10-20% of the time we were there. We didn't mind this very much since we were in Berlin on holiday and only tried to access the web for trip planning and personal email. This is definitely something to consider for business travelers. Other considerations: The hotel is located in the Frederichain district, an up and coming and increasingly gentrifying/yuppified part of town but it still has much of its gritty character and industrial quality (at least for now). There are several restaurants and interesting boutiques/stores (selling clothing, jewelry, art, etc.) within a walking distance from the hotel. The Michelberger is also within walking distance from the East Side gallery. The U-bahn and S-bahn stations are located across the hotel. Berlin is very well connected by public transportation (i.e. trains, trams, etc.) and the major attractions (i.e. Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Christmas markets) are no more than 20-30 mins by train from the hotel. The hotel is 45 minutes to an hour by train or bus to Tegel/TXL airport. I would guess the guest age demographic at the hotel is between early 20s to early 40s but that does not mean you can't stay here if you're much older. It depends on your preference. We stayed at the "cozy" room which is certainly true to its name. The room is very basic with a full sized bed, bathroom and toilet. I would say this room is best for couples. The Michelberger has other bigger rooms (more loft-like spaces) available. Our room was all the way in the back and it was generally very quiet so we managed to get a good night's sleep during our stay. I'm not sure how sound proof the other rooms are especially when there is live music playing or an event at the bar downstairs. All in all, we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun first time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JessNYC23
Reviews.Content: 2 friends and I traveled to Berlin for the first time this month and decided to stay at the Michelberger because it looked cool, was a great price and good location in Friedrichschain. Berlin turned out to be the most amazing place and our stay at the Michelberger definitely contributed to that sentiment. The rooms are big and clean, the breakfast is a delicious smorgasbord of German food (and the dining room is gorgeous), the bar is a fun place to hang and the staff are super friendly. The staff were more than willing to show us how to get places on maps, recommend restaurants and nightlife -- all recommendations were spot on. Only a few small complaints: 1) the wireless seems to be a little spotty throughout the hotel. I wasn't able to pick it up at all and you need to get an individual code to access it. Weird. 2) there are no phones/landlines in the rooms. if you don't have international service on your mobile phone, you're pretty much out of luck. There is a hostel a few doors down that has an international pre-paid phone booth that's not too inconvenient to use if necessary. 3) They advertise that they have sandwiches and snacks available 24hrs, but actually they don't. We came back starving from a night out hoping there'd be something to grab in the bar area and there was nothing. We ended up having to go to the pretty gross kebab shop down the street. Plan accordingly. 4) One afternoon, we asked a girl at the front desk to recommend some shopping streets in Kreuzberg to check out and instead of showing us quickly or telling us to take a short walk over the bridge down the street on the right, she told us to buy these Michelberger Guide maps for 1 euro each and sent us on our way. I felt a little ripped off. I get it, they want to sell these guides but it would've been nice if she had opened them and taken 30 seconds to show us where to go. Overall we had an amazing time and I would definitely stay here again. If you stay here, be sure to take the free Alternative Berlin walking tour that's advertised and meets in the lobby -- it's totally worth your while.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: TimTheGuest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 6 times and each time I have been impressed on a number of levels. Friendly attentive staff, they remember me now and greet me personally which is a nice touch. The bar and lounge area is very nicely laid out with good music, a well stocked bar and comfy sofas to relax on after a hard night in Berghain. There is a range of rooms from "Cosy" which is very cheap and ideal for a quick stop over, right up to penthouse rooms and large rooms for groups of people. The rooms are well laid out, very quiet, excellent shower and shower room. The beds are very comfy and the rooms are always extremely clean. Breakfast is €11 and well worth it, smoked salmon, salami, cheese, eggs, beef kebabs! Everything you could wish for with a selection of Croissants and Pastries etc. They even have Soya Milk for people who are lactose intolerant. The hotel is located opposite Warshauer Strasse mainline station, easy to get to both airports or to Alexander Platz, Ostbahnhof, Oestkruez and Freidricshain (excuse my spelling). You can also access most tourist attractions very easily. This hotel won't suit everyone as it is not your typical 5 Star hotel chain but if you like individuality, slightly quirky places with a 5 Star service in comfortable, clean and laid back surroundings then this is the place for you. I get the impression it is a fun place to work as the staff turnover seems very low and I see lots of familiar faces each time I return. I will be back next year definitely

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Franca M
Reviews.Content: It's the perfect place to stay: really large clean super comfortable and quiet rooms, friendly helpful people and a great bar to hang out, have a drink and listen to music: you don't need to leave the place at all to have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “best place for hipsters”
Reviews.Author: volpelinoantwerp
Reviews.Content: really great place to stay in berlin. although low budget, the interieur shows a lot of love in detail. it looks very trendy yet functional and cozy. the staff is very helpful and friendly. in the evenings, a DJ is clubbing in the lobby of the hotel and makes it a perfect place to hang out. don't miss the breakfast (jummy)! it is located directly at u- and s-bahn. discover nightlife by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Self-facilitating media nodes”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell C
Reviews.Content: You could not wish to encounter a more pretentious, vacuous crowd then the one the Michelberger so carefully attracts and nurtures. Nathan Barley would love it.These soulless ironic types are admittedly ten-a-penny in Berlin nowadays but the Michelberger must be their number one hang-out. The fabric of the hotel is of an acceptable standard (apart from the cheap, uncomfortable beds) but you'll pay half the price for the same standard if you can forego the "cool" of this unfathomably overrated place.

Reviews.Title: “way above expectations!”
Reviews.Author: b-inabag
Reviews.Content: we came across this place in a travel magazine and loved the description even then. but when we stayed there liked it even more. its a fun place, offers you a hostel like feel but with the convenience + look of a hotel. its young and hip with a bar on the ground floor if you feel like staying indoors. the rooms are spacious and nice. we stayed at whats called the loft (if i remember right) its spacious and big enough for two. there are a few quaint things in the room, which of course you want to pocket, but they warn you against it! there were some books on berlin which we carried along when we roamed around the city. good to browse in the trains etc. so look out for those... the bathrooms are huge - almost as big as some of the rooms we stayed at during the rest of your trip! everything is neat and clean. and even the bathrooms have facilities for the handicapped. the soap / shampoo is in a BIIIGGG dispenser that gets filled every second day. and the shower its really nice. the right amount of force without any worries about wasting that extra water! conveniently located - near the stations (S-bahn+ U-bahn) and walking distance from a whole bunch of eateries. the staff is extremely helpful and are able to answer a whole lot of questions. an excellent experience, hip and urban but yet not too young and in-your-face! worth repeating if we visit berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awsome”
Reviews.Author: ArtisaCritic
Reviews.Content: The coolest place to hang out - with a really stylish bar and rooms if i visit Berlin (hopefully when) i would love to stay here again, The staff were very friendly speaking fluent english and allowing us to keep our bags in a safe closet before and after our room was ready and going home. With the Ubahn across the road it felt anywhere in the city was easily acessible. There was a great burger place across the bridge renovated from an old toilet block. The room was nice and very stylish however the lights in the bathroom were rubbish small dark and shining in your face they should sort them out. The WiFi appeared to be dodgy at the time of visiting and also one evening music was being played really loudly which was disturbing but other than that the hotel was fantastic. The breakfast although not included should be enjoyed at least once with an amazing range of choices (croissants, scrambled eggs and smoked salmon was my indulgence). Overall the stay was very enjoyable and i would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for that chic Berliner style

Reviews.Title: “Fun, stylish and comfortable hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: LondonZoeJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last weekend and had a great time. It is really well priced for what it offers which is somewhere clean, cool and comfortable to relax when you're not out enjoying the highlights of Berlin! Less than 10 minutes walk from Watergate, Maxim and the Berghain/Panorama Bar with lots of nice restaurants and bars a short walk away in the centre of Friedrichshein. We also really enjoyed a falafel at a cool little place a few moments walk away from the Michelberger. Having the UBahn and S-Bahn opposite makes it ultra convenient for the rest of Berlin too. We'll definitely be back on our next trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be missed!!”
Reviews.Author: conin
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel, we did not want to leave. Easy going, relaxed staff greeted us, checkin a breeze. Rooms very clean and very quirky. We had a loft room which sleeps 2 perfectly and 3 if you have an extra guest. The bar/lobby area is a must to hang out and relax during the late afternoon and evening, light food available. Staff very friendly and a couple of them actually had a drink with us after work. Had dinner in the restaurant on the Friday night followed by a disco/dj's in the bar/lounge area - fantastic night!!! The design of the hotel is very quirky and we could not stop taking pictures of everything!!! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at Michelberger Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MartinKaufmann
Reviews.Content: Late August 2011 my girlfriend and I stayed for three nights at Michelberger. The hotel is great, excellent rooms, friendly staff, good food and very inspirational. Combined with good prices this hotel is worth using. A few more words and photos to be found on my blog: http://www.martinkaufmann.dk/2011/10/michelberger-hotel-berlin/ All the best, Martin

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun base for a great time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: alexpinna
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a fun-loving crowd. Well designed hotel, great bar and social areas. Cosy room is small but perfect for a couple. Very clean and good sound proofing. Breakfast is great. Staff are very friendly and will point you at a decent place to go for a drink or party. Excellent location - good access to some off the track East Berlin clubs including Suicide Circus and Berghain.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for Berlin mini break”
Reviews.Author: ajc75
Reviews.Content: We picked the Michelberger Hotel as it was recommended in the Saturday Times - and we are really pleased we did. The hotel is in a great location, right opposite the tram, S-bahn and U-bahn stations and easily accessible from the airport and into the centre of Berlin. I would recommend that you buy one of Michelberger's local maps highlighting restaurants that they like. We ate at a few of these and they were all great - most were a little off the tourist trail and we wouldn't have found them ourselves. We did have lunch in the hotel one day - very tasty and great value for money. We stayed in a Loft room which is a great use of space and like the rest of the hotel, full of quirky features. We had three nights at the Michelberger, and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great rooms, friendly staff and fantastic breakfasts and all at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: SW1LL
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Berlin with my sister. The hotel managed to find us a late room as we only decided to go the week before we flew. Very accommodating. I'd seen this place recommended in Sunday Times Travel mag last month as one of their favourite hotels in Europe, so we though we'd give Michelberger a try. Housed in an old warehouse this hotel is budget friendly but with a cool boutique hotel feel. Very bohemian and easy going. Staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The bar (Honolulu) is great fun and relaxed. Drinks are reasonable and a hot chocolate and fresh mint tea were a nice afternoon pit-stop treat. The restaurant area where we had breakfast was roomy and spacious and the food itself was yummy and was a great start to the day. Hotel is located just opposite a tram and metro station, so very easy to get to all parts of the city. There are some cool Sunday flea markets walking distance from the hotel which are worth checking out, plus you get to mingle with the locals too. We stayed in a 'cosy room' which was certainly cosy, but space was used to the maximum and although furnishings were minimal we loved the decor and little bits of artwork, laminated pics, wallpaper and books. The bathroom/wet room too was also cosy but did the job. Very modern and well finished. Probably not the room for you if you're not comfortable sharing with someone you don't know intimately (as there isn't much place to move). Loved Michelberger for its easy-going vibe, friendly staff and great service all at a really great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, Berlin in a microcosm!”
Reviews.Author: hmidkiff25
Reviews.Content: Unique, artsy, and funky decor, live and loud music, freindly travellers and staff alike...not to mention a glass-walled shower whose inhabitant is best viewed supinely from the bed?? We had a great stay here, and while they accidentally charged our card twice, they quick to remedy the problem. There is little reason to leave the space with the excellent food, drinks and live entertainment prepared by the staff each evening (thought this can be forced upon you due to its loudness). When you are ready to leave, all of Berlin is steps out the door, (literally the East side gallery is meters away), as is the tram, bus and train. Highly recommmeded kitcsh!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tsops
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I have ever been. Not the luxury style, but very clever solutions for everything. Client orientated, higjly designed features and devoted service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Foolfin
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger could have been straight from a movie: a whole country band in full dress hanging by the bar, ping pong tournament in the yard and, of course, The big lebowksi playing 24/24 on the inhouse tvs... Overall, great breakfast, good value for money and, if the east side is your location of choice then certainly worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly & fun but loud till 11pm”
Reviews.Author: jungleberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after staying at another hotel on Friedrichstrss for two nights last weekend (Sunday night). Personally, I loved its funky ambience and young and friendly staffs yet it might be a bit too loud for older guests who mind DJ playing music/people chatting and playing table tennis in the courtyard. Location is relatively convenient as major train/metro system is right across the street from the hotel. Maybe it was just this Sunday but there was lots of young people hanging out in the courtyard and it was fun for me to enjoy the scene and eat BBQ for dinner. It provides free Wifi and rooms are very fun and originally designed. Will I stay again - yes for sure for another few more years but if you are traveling with your parents, I would choose a quieter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lively Berlin awakes with the incredible Michel Berger Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not situated in the most quiet part in Berlin, but I (44) and my nephew (14) Matthijs really loved it! The East side gallery and great Oberbaumbrücke at one side and the graffity at the other side, the outgoing youth make it a lively neighbourhood and we like this. I'm pretty used to busy Amsterdam, so the S-bahn sound in the street made me feel at home. The hotel is really like presented on the internet: all these nice details! The room with high bed and lounge corner with great desk to write out postcards was comfortable and nice to arrive in the evening. The large windows where great to open for some time in the evening. The staff, whereever they helped you, were very polite and helpfull. They all spoke fluently English, but I self prefered they spoke Deutsch, ich mag auch diese Sprache! With all of them you feel yourself a kind of at home and at ease! Breakfast was fantastic, really worth the € 11,00 pp. Every morning we choosed whatever we liked, every morning there was something special. Don't need to say I had to lose some pounds after visiting Berlin! Eating in Berlin is great in quality. For prices I only remember in Amsterdam long ago! Next time I go to Berlin, I will return to Michel Berger hotel. I also hope I will be some more evenings in their lounge on the ground floor, mostly we arived in the evening, Berlin stays alive in the evening! Special thanks to Michel Berger staff, room designers, kitchen cooks and helpers and the cleaners! Thank you for holidays we won't forget for long times! Matthijs (14) and Jan (44)

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this place to us and after having stayed there even for just one night I'll recommend it to you, reader, as well. Highly. One of the most unique hotels I've had the pleasure of staying. If you're charmed by design and creative use of space this place is especially for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, unique, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: eameschair
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. So different to the many overpriced, generic, standardised hotels I've stayed in. We had The Loft room which was really spacious for 2 and would have been perfect for 3 also. The hotel and rooms are uniquely designed with a high quality finishes. There were small touches everywhere that really made this place great - some included the fun bottle stickers or Do Not Disturb signs and the bird noises in the toilets! The brunch buffet is excellent quality and good if you want to fill up for the day. The bar is fantastic, chilled out and the drink is reasonably priced (although more expensive than nearby pubs). The u-bahn stop is just across the street and the s-bahn up the road a little.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool - but need new cleaners!”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights as part of a family holiday. We all loved the hotel and the area. We are definitely East Berlin fans. The rooms were great and worked well for us with teenage children. My gripes however would be about noise and cleanliness. Room overlooked the central courtyard and it was impossible to have the window open at night if you wanted to sleep. Parties 2 nights until early hours of the morning. This wasn't too disasterous as it wasn't particualrly hot when we stayed, but if the sun had been shining in Berlin.... Of greater concern was the poor standard of cleaning inthe room. One of the beds in our 3 bedded room hadn't been made on our arrival - so we reported this to reception. Bedding was delivered late that night (though we were left to make the bed ourselves), but no clean bottom sheet was provided and the one on the bed was dirty. I reported this to reception the next day but nothing was done. I had to report it a second time before a new sheet was provided. Room cleaning also seemed very cursory - not sure it happened at all one day and scarcely on the others. We loved our stay - and will be back to Berlin. Would love to stay at the Michelberger again, but please, please do improve the cleaning and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary, and to be frank, unsafe!”
Reviews.Author: Neededalobotomy
Reviews.Content: I like to party as much as the next person but arriving to find a used needle in our bin and stains on the so called "clean sheets" was neither acceptable nor sanitary. The staff were exceptionally rude and condescending. To make matters worse the hotel decided to throw a party in the central courtyard in which djs played deafeningly loud music continously from 1pm until 1am on a sunday. We were not informed of this event until after we had checked in and thus we were told it was too late too cancel our booking. All in all it was a traumatic stay and was definitely not worth the 60 euros they charged for there inadequate facilities. I would highly recommend that this hotel is avoided at all costs if you value hygiene, comfort and any sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great idea, mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lauraelkha
Reviews.Content: Conceptually the Michelberger is great - when we first arrived we were enamoured with our loft room, as designers we appreciated the clever yet cost effective details throughout the room and hotel in general. We chose this hotel not because of the cheap price but because we wanted something unique - which is something I needed to keep reminding myself when being frustrated at not having comforts that we were used to like A/C which meant having to throw our mattresses down the steps to sleep on the floor during the hot nights we experienced. We had a room that faced onto the street and got EXTREMELY hot. There were powered shutters on the windows yet they had a mind of their own - sometimes working when we wanted them to and sometimes not at all, other times just opening up on their own. Wrangling them was a constant battle we gave up on in the end. We were actually more than happy to spend more than we did and stay in a better room, but all were booked out. It must be said that the breakfast was fantastic - a delicious spread with great variety in a gorgeous space with the perfect morning vibe and, as all things at Michelberger, was very reasonably priced. We so wanted to love this hotel but my partner and I left with mixed feelings. 50% of the staff were great, 50% indifferent or just unavailable. The room was cool, yet not comfortable. The location provided great U-Bahn & S-Bahn accessibility and an easy walk to Kreuzberg, but in itself was not great... In summary I would suggest to think of it more as somewhere to stay that positions itself closer to hostel than hotel, a week during summer was too long for us, but 3-4 days during a winter could be fine and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Hot”
Reviews.Author: QuincyKid
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife and 3 teenage sons) stayed at the Michelberger and found it to be a very interesting and fun place. The atmosphere of cool is mirrored in the rooms with the bunk beds and ropes for towel holders. Breakfast was well worth the money too. Our only complaint is that we were there on two hot nights and air conditioning would have been nice both for the temperature and to keep down the noise from the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: alilaw6
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a long weekend with a group of friends. The hotel is oozing with character and was in a perfect location. We stayed in one of the loft rooms and there was plenty of room for five girls. The downstairs bar was fun at night and the staff were very helpful in pointing us in the direction during the day. The hotel also has a great breakfast, which is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvelyneA06
Reviews.Content: Stylish, smart, friendly and fun...it feels like at home

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing for two different generations!”
Reviews.Author: Dindi_SE
Reviews.Content: I was at the the Michelberger with my mother and some of her friends (I am 24 and my mom and her friends over 50), and I have to say we all enjoyed the experience immensely! Because we arrived in Berlin very early, we had to wait a bit before being allowed into our rooms, but that was absolutely not a problem! Staff was friendly and the huge reading rooms with thousands of books to choose from and great comfortable couches is fantastic! The building and surroundings can look odd at first - but do not let yourself be fooled by that. The rooms are great, clean, full of light and interesting architectural and design touches that always allow you to found something new. The rooms we stayed in had no air-conditioner. Because we were there in September, it was absolutely not a problem - but perhaps it might be in different months of the year. The hotel bar is great - my mother and her friends always found new interesting drinks and great late-night light snacks. Even though it is not located in the city center, public transportation is easily accessible - in fact, a big station is located just across the street from the hotel. As an additional surprise, brazilian music was playing when we arrived, it was a good way to feel welcome! The restaurant offers great portions of food for incredibly reasonable prices - after all, this is Berlin! - but the breakfast buffet is the best I have seen. Anyway, surely not enough to downgrade our opinion about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ghafsaas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so perfect, I almost doesn't want to tell anybody about it. It is a very cool and trendy hotel, with a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A super cool place for young people”
Reviews.Author: mirasol08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at tthe Michelberger over the weekend on a friend's recommendation. We had a fantastic time there and the location was brilliant. We got excellent recommendations from staff for restaurants and bars in the area and the lounge/bar area is open late and great for chilling out. Only thing that I was slightly surprised by was the shower in our bedroom. It was right by the bed and the wall separating the two had a huge transparent window looking into it - not even frosted one bit! Fine if you are staying with a boyfriend/girlfriend etc but not so great if you are a little shy :-) It's not a big deal though - I will definitely be coming back to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, and affordable...”
Reviews.Author: Ennaei
Reviews.Content: The lobby is welcoming and comfy, with lots to do (books, late night dance parties, etc...). The courtyard is nice as well with ping pong, bbqs and breakfast. Great service and located next to the tram, U bahn and train.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Inspirational”
Reviews.Author: xstaceynyc
Reviews.Content: Michelberger was recommended by a Designer in Berlin. My husband had also seen photos in Creative Review. We had the room with the tiny stairs and upstairs sleeping loft facing the courtyard. I was concerned it might be noisy at night, but I was out until it least 2 am each night so it was fine. I loved it. The people who work there are super nice and helpful. We don't speak German, but it was not a problem. There are tons of art books and novels in the lobby. Everything from the cooler in the breakfast buffet "I have no arms or legs, help yourself" to the hallway playing an endless loop of The Big Lebowski made me feel like I was on a real vacation. The design details are thoughtful and charming. I am now obsessed with the breakfast room with the hanging white lights, long rustic tables and variety of chairs. There were fresh flowers all over the hotel, usually in some combination with orange. The train is across the street: so convenient! The food is quite good. We loved the buffet, the pitchers of water with lime, mint and currants. The lunch salads and pasta were great as well. They were going to have a dj with a bbq the weekend that we left- it sounded fun. The room is funky, it's not luxurious. The bed and towels are not super comfortable. The stairs/ ladder going up to the bed is not for everyone. (there's a day bed on the main floor if you're too drunk). I found the city of Berlin so exciting that I didn't really want to hang out in my room. There is not a gym, but you can rent bicycles down the street. I stay in a lot of corporate hotels when I travel for work. I was really charmed by the design and personal details of the Michelberger. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel concept is great but is an average hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: LalanRobbie
Reviews.Content: We were very captivated by the website and hence decided to stay at this hotel. It was a much bigger hotel than we had anticipated - but this was good. We had a loft room which faced the main road. Unfortunately there was no A/C and this was a big downside for us, because we experienced some hot days and nights. Luckily there was a small fan next to the beds; which saved us. The loft room has a toilet with shower, TV, some comfy loungy thing and a sink; downstairs. Upstairs is just a bed - or shall I say 2 thin matresses side-by-side. The beds could have been better. PRO's: * Even though the room faced the main streets, it was quiet at night once we closed the windows. * It is a funky hotel with an awesome (and Fresh) buffet breakfast - with anything you could ever want. * Sometimes the hotel organises lunches, dinners, BBQ's outside in their bar, which is really cool - good atmosphere. Really good use of space * Mostly the staff were friendly * Awesome for transport - 1 minute away from both S and U Bahn stations. CONS: * Bed could have been improved; werent big fans of the 2 thin mattresses side-by-side. * We couldn't seem to get our room serviced properly on 2/4 nights that we stayed. After the 1st night, they took away our towels and didnt replace them. So we were left with one wet bath towel and 1 wet floor towel. Toilet paper wasnt replaced either. We had to ask for some from the cleaner we saw in the hallway. * Location - wasnt as close as we would have liked - it was about 15minute walk to the more lively streets in this area. Overall, we had a good stay, but will probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Hipster's Hotel/Hostel: Different and interesting. The best? ...Not sure!”
Reviews.Author: Psicoloco
Reviews.Content: Hello readers, hope you're enjoying your day! Well, we stayed at this interesting Hotel through July 2 till July 7 2011 traveling as a couple; we chose this place because of the reviews posted in this site and also because of the Hotel's website which let me tell you, it captivated us! Yet we didn't made a bast research of Hotel options which we should have done. Now that we experienced it I would say that we ended up with "mixed up" thoughts about it; the best thing of this place is definitively the price! Although Berlin is very cheap city (no using the word "cheap" as a pejorative) but for sure this hotel is a good bargain for what it offers; basically we did OK in this hotel, not awful not excellent, but OK... And I would say that this Hotel has a very peculiar public as a target which might be young Hipsters, alternative personalities, modern design lovers/freaks , local arts scene dudes, in other words something very "Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg"; we're not gonna use "lay-back" as an adjective to describe this place since we didn't experience that vibe (in general) actually we observed some amount of pose and attitude but again its a Hipster thing. So if you're an average tourist, a family, someone looking for a regular hotel features, someone traveling without a budget or none of the above mentioned I would rather suggest looking for more "orthodox" options. Now we would try to explain very objectively OUR thoughts about this place with a PROS and CONS list, (we find necessary to mention that this comes out from our personal experience and we do not intend to give rather a good or bad impression about this interesting place, just personal perception): CONS: - Dumpster: As a the previous reviewer said, choose wisely your room (avoid 212 to 238 rooms), there's a huge local dumpster just in the back of the hotel and it's not only the view what is mortifying, since there's no AC in the rooms you'll have to open you window to get some fresh air (now imagine whats next!), also, activity at this dumpster starts very early so if you have a light sleep be prepared to be woken up by machinery noises. - Beds: Beds are not so comfortable so people with back problems, be aware. - WiFi: So slow! - AC: No AC in the rooms and believe me, Berlin can get very hot and humid in summer. - Layout: Reception and Hotel Entrance layout, to reach the reception (and hotel's elevator) you need to cross through the bar's lobby and the bar, this might be OK or cool for some people but since there's a party every night it might get very crowded, some nights we dealt with crowds (and very drunk people) to get into the hotel after a long and tiring day out. So if you're not intending to stay in the party, this is not a very comfortable feature. - Attitude from some of the personnel: this is a very interesting point, we were attended by six different people during our stay (in the bar, in the reception and in the restaurant) and I would say that 3 from 3 were cool, kind and helpful, the other 3 were very indifferent, long faced and we felt like they were annoyed by our questions and/or requests. We thought this might be because of the lack of English (not everyone speaks good English and we don't speak German, LOL) or a cultural thing but a couple of German friends (one living Mitte and the other one in Friedichshain, Berlin) told us that it was all attitude, they used the phase "Sh***y Berlin Hipster's Attitude" and that because of the hotel concept and vibe it would a common thing to get it. Well the point is that since its a Hotel, good quality customer service must be always a must, and even tho they're cultural differences between locals and tourists, a Hotel staff is expected to know them and manage them to make their guests stay pleasant and comfortable. PROS: - Location: Such a huge plus; Warschauerstrasse S/U Bahn (just across the street) connects you with everywhere worth visit in Berlin. There's a Kaiser's supermarket about 5 minutes away from the hotel were you can buy treats, booze, groceries, etc. - Nightlife: If you like the night life you have amazing bars and clubs near the hotel like The Berghain, The Waterfront, The Lido, the Ichiban Karaoke, all bars, restaurants and venues around Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg. And if you like to walk, well you can reach Alexaderplatz in just 20 minutes away. - East Side Gallery: Just around the corner. - Concept: The concept is amazing, more than a common stay its an experience, we really think that it gives you a good idea about what's happening in Berlin's design, cultural and art scene. Obviously they're a bunch of good designers and artist beyond this project which is a very interesting thing to observe and experience. - Some of the staff: Again, half of the personnel that assisted us during our stay was very helpful and friendly, there's this tall and pretty girl in the reception that was extraordinary helpful and attentive, sadly we saw here once during our check in process. - The Bar: Well if you're don't wanna party outside the Hotel you can do it inside, there's something going on every night, a local rock band, a cool DJ, etc. - Price: for us, the best feature of this place is the price. Such a bargain! Before Berlin we visited Belgium, The Netherlands and other cities of North Germany and this was the best deal as for hotels. If you're using your hotel just for sleeping and shower I believe this might be a good option just because of the price. Overall this Hotel might be enjoyable or the opposite depending on taste, interests and expectations. If you're a frequent Hostel customer this place might be amazing (also if you're into the Hipster scene) but If you often stay in regular 3-5 stars hotel, think it twice and be aware. If coming back to Berlin this hotel might be a second option if we don't find a better place to stay. Have a nice day!

Reviews.Title: “Pick your room wisely to avoid the rubbish dump! Good vibe but facilities lacking”
Reviews.Author: HonestH
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this stay but have mixed feelings. We had a horrible location tiny budget room (226) over the rubbish dump but our friends stayed in the luxe gold room and loved it. Breakfast although nice was expensive at 11euros each. We didn't stay in the room much, Berlin is there to explored, it turned out to be a good stay. However, the low point merits mentioning. First night some idiot set the firelarm off at 3am, so we had to walk through corridors of chemicals, waiting outside without explanation for 45minutes only to returning to our room door open (with all our belongings/passport / creditcard/cameras in there) without appology or explanation, let alone refund by staff Positives: Nice relaxed vibe in hotel, friendly staff, communal spaces were comfortable & stylish. Transport is on doorstep, location is excellent for kreuzberg and friedrichstein bars. Lovely hotel dog. Free wifi Negatives: Budget room which was absolutely tiny; 3 hooks for a wardrobe; shower was an clear window so not only could the room see us shower, but the worker from the rubbish dump saw naked. The toilet in the room meant this was far from a romantic stay. Without a fan or air conditioning we had to leave the window open so the noise (bin men every day incl. weekend started at 6am plus birds squarking over rubbish) and smell wasn't fun. A ceiling fan would help enormously!! Top tip: Get a room overlooking the courtyard! The budget room is hostel standard so i'd pay extra for better accommodation & if you can afford it treat yourself to the luxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic84
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations from all the reviews on Tripadvisor, but was disappointed with our stay. The hotel was definitely cool, funky, and alternative, but had more of a hostel feel than a hotel feel. For example, our sheets were never changed during our 4 night stay, the room was humid and stuffy but we couldn't leave our windows open at night given the raucous on Warschauer Strasse, the internet (although free) was SLOW, and despite asking several times we could not get any helpful information from the hotel staff (for the first 2 days we couldn't even get a map)! We asked for restaurant recommendations and they just pointed to a general direction of where there were a lot of restaurants. Also, if you're in the loft-style room, be careful of the stairs leading up to the bed! There isn't any traction on the steps and it quite hurts when you fall (said from experience).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairedigby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Michelberger Hotel with my boyfriend for 4 nights and 5 days (6th June-10th) and i can not give this hotel a better review. We stayed in the cozy room and at first I was quite concerned that the room might be too small but when we arrived I couldn't have been more wrong. Yes the room is a little on the small side but with the high ceilings and clever lay out this room is one of the nicest I've stayed in. The court yard and lounge are amazing! and all the staff are so friendly. I was a little worried as my German isn't great but all the staff speak perfect English and are very polite. The breakfast was lovely, lots of fresh fruit and the location couldn't be better. Trams, U Bahn and the S Bahn are right on the door step. I will definitely be coming back to Berlin and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “So good, I dont want everyone to know about it”
Reviews.Author: Tjukkebolla
Reviews.Content: This place made our entire trip. The funky details in the rooms, the cafe, the free concert in the courtyard....it was so entirely brilliant I would like to live there. I dream about that place. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: hanna8577
Reviews.Content: Surpassed our (high) expectations – we got a really spacious, clean and quirky room (not for the disabled…). Staff were super friendly and helpful, we couldn't have wished for a better stay. If you're a light sleeper then this might be a little bit noisy for you, the room was also pretty warm but there was a pretty powerful desktop fan which helped. The bar was also really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Free guiding tour in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Hnordin
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the cool hotel Michelberger Juni 2. we spotted a sign on the reception wall for a free city tour. At 12.30 a young, relaxed english guide called Mark arrived. Together with another small group we got an interesting and alternative city-tour by foot and U-bahn, We visited YAAM-beach (http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g187323-d718863-Reviews-Yaam-Berlin.html), Tacheles (http://super.tacheles.de/cms/), among others. All we paid was a small tip eatch to Mark, and our subway ticket. Thanks to hotel M for introducing this. Warmly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “super small room”
Reviews.Author: BouH
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good design, although I can't same the same about the rooms - nothing special. The room was like a kennel for a dog, it was super small, only bed inside and shower with toilet with a transparent window. There is a garbage collector in front of the room with a garbage car always move to and fro with noise. Warsauerstr - good district with many bars and restaurants, but think about stopping at this hotel twice.

Reviews.Title: “If you're trendy then this hotel is perfect for you”
Reviews.Author: monkeykieran
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times, as it is in a great location if you like visiting the bars and clubs of Friedrichshain, opposite Warschauerstrasse station. The lobby, bar and reception are like the staff very welcoming to all guests even if you are a bit worse for wear. The lobby is really chilled and relaxed but I always get a sense that it full of "Trendy" brits who think they're all a bit cool for school, great if you like that sort of thing, but not really my vibe. The breakfast is fantastic, good range, very fresh, pity theres never freshly squeezed juice just that made from concentrate stuff but not the end of the world. The rooms are very basic, in decor and facilities, the hotel aims for this minimal vibe aside from the random assortments of books and things), but I personally find it a bit too plain and I think the shared rooms have the beds too close to each other on the mezzanine levels and the mattresses could be a lot better all round. From memory it costs only a bit more to get a room by yourself or with two people than it costs for 3 or more so id suggest doing that as there isn't much space in the shared rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky place for a salesmeeting”
Reviews.Author: 1822910Geert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 7 people and used the Whiskey room as meeting room Do not expect the standard meeting rooms but a sort of living room atmosphere to hold your meetings which also impacts the way you discuss things The rooms are not large but accommodating, clean. The hotel breathes a Berlinesque style. The patio is nice for lunch. You are near Kreuzberg and near clubbing areas. There are a lot of people walking the street at night switching clubs but this is not creating problems . Watch out for the bicycles if you coming out of the hotel, the gain a lot of speed going down the slope; We were near the tramway but were not bothered by noise or trembling sensations. The bar is inviting and the hotel has an overall hang loose feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel - awesome value”
Reviews.Author: oconut
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel with compact, clean rooms, a great bar & cafe downstairs, and an amazing breakfast buffet (I'm talking smoked salmon for breakfast baby). Staff were helpful and it's close to the U-bahn and S-bahn. Walking distance to decent restaurants and a short train ride anywhere else. The whole hotel has a funky style with a lot of really smart additions that make life easier, internet, books in the rooms, alarm clocks. I think this is the best value hotel I have ever stayed in. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “All those little details”
Reviews.Author: amaral82
Reviews.Content: Different hotel with small little gems all over. Check the non-smoking sign, the body wash bottle warning sign, the alarm clock, the small pictures in your room, the not-disturb sign, etc.. But even the whole design and set up of the hotel is quite amazing. Great rooms and breakfast. The only negatives was that internet was down, and we were not offered a refund (despite asking for it) and that the security guard at night would not let us in with food! ("It smells bad", he said in German). But hey, you can't help the Germans' general sense of service (or lack thereof). :) Yet, I would definitely recommend the hotel if you are in the look for something different and an experience in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, amazing atmosphere and vibe”
Reviews.Author: oilir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with some friends over Easter, and I can honestly say I don't remember when I would have stayed at such a great hotel ! The atmosphere of the whole place is great - (super) friendly staff, funky interior (rooms, lobby etc), inner yard is excellent for chilling etc. Grab a beer at the bar, play some guitar (or two...) in the lobby and enjoy the vibe of the place and the great people who stay (or stray) there - I would recommend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Really cool and exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: LauraMandMattJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Michelberger last week and had a great time. The hotel looks great on the website and looks even better in real life! It was really cool and designed really well, with lots of interesting bits and pieces to look at. Although it was an achingly cool place to stay, it wasn't intimidating or scary in any way and had a really relaxed and chilled out atmosphere. We enjoyed drinking in the bar area, sitting on the comfy sofas and watching the world go by. The breakfast was great with the most amazing scrambled eggs and lovely fresh fruit. We booked oone of the cosy rooms and that describes the room perfectly, even though it was small though it worked really well for a couple and the bed was really comfy. It also had a great outside courtyard which was lovely to relax in in the evening. Lastly, the location was great, right opposite a U-Bahn station and it is only a short walk up the road to an area full of great bars, shops and restaurants. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: kuchen1973
Reviews.Content: It's a cool hotel with a cool bar, with cool rooms, in a cool neighborhood and with cool staff. If you yourself are not cool, do not fret. Just by staying here, you will start to feel dandy. The price for the rooms is more than fair and some of the great party locations in Berlin are a short walk away. And even if you don't feel like taking that walk, the hotel organizes a Friday night disco-dinner soiree with the perfect mixture of locals, alcohol and flashy lights. The breakfast is also great.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I'll be staying in in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: mdbell
Reviews.Content: (..under my current budget, obviously.) If you're looking for somewhere cheap and central in Berlin, this is a place for you and you won't have to compromise on cleanliness, quality or comfort. The Michelberger has all of this. It's a convenient location - not slap bang in the centre, with Berlin's excellent public transport, you might as well be. This hotel does more than just ticking all the boxes; it has a real charm and cool vibe. It's unfalteringly modern and cool. You can tell the owners have had a lot of fun kitting out this hotel, without taking itself too seriously. It's full of little quirks, which you'll discover for yourself. We found all the staff to be friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel seemed to be full of people aged 18-30. There's no reason why anyone else should be put off, but you might like to have it in mind. I'd recommend to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Rad”
Reviews.Author: happylittlevegemites
Reviews.Content: Best hotel that I have ever stayed at.... we wanted to live there. Couldn't of designed it better myself. Great value, location, decor, vibe, coffee, courtyard and most importanly room. Even got a peak at the "book room" when walking down the corridor and want to stay there next time. Looked incredible with an entire feature wall of novels. Did the Friday night "Disco Dinner" which was excellent. And then moved into the hotel bar to watch the live band and lounge about and listen to the dj. But before we went to bed we had a quick game of ping pong in the foyer. Even in winter it was a great place to stay, can only imagine how much fun it would be in the summer when the courtyard would come into full swing.

Reviews.Title: “The most awesome hotel in the world (and a great value)!!”
Reviews.Author: DLRtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem of Berlin. If more hotels would be like Michelberger, I would never own my own house. Beginning from the innovative design to the extremely helpful and friendly staff, to the exquisite breakfast served in the cafe - this gem is perfect for business or leisure travel. You will be inspired, refreshed, and want to come back to Berlin just for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Town”
Reviews.Author: ipcollins
Reviews.Content: This places just oozes cool! I stayed here for 6 nights with my wife and it was perfect. The rooms were very well designed and extremely comfortable, it was right near a main underground and overland train station, there is plenty happening around the area, and even the hotel goes off a few nights a week! It is a popular spot for locals to come and drink coffe or watch some live music in the very cool foyer/bar. The rooms were generally well priced and good value for money. The breakfast in the morning is also good value for money, and is delicious healthy food. The staff were also very cool and catered to our needs. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alone Was Worth the Trip!”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiPatti
Reviews.Content: Since we were traveling with 2 teens (19 and 16), we initially considered apts in Berlin, but then found Michelberger on Trip Advisor and were smitten by the website. We stayed in one of the Band Rooms, with the loft beds. It was minimalist, clean, and comfortable, with lots of nooks and crannies for storage. The breakfast room, with its incredible buffet and selections for every special diet need, was a beautiful place to start the day. Since we'd never been to Berlin, the nicest surprise was how close we were to 2 major mass transit lines. If you're used to little L'Occitane shampoo bottles and cutesy matching spa robes, this is not the place for you. If, like us, you like arty & funky, and something a little different, we'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly value in this stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lukesmith1975
Reviews.Content: I've been guilty of having promised to write on trip advisor in the past but not delivering. Hotel MichelBerger has changed this, what a fantastic hotel. From the staff to the rooms everything was excellent and reasonably priced. We came to Berlin for nightlife but found the bar in Michelberger the best place we visited. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “michelberger hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankec64
Reviews.Content: everything about this place was fantastic!!!!!!! rooms are clean and tidy the the people on the front desk are amazingly friendly (ms Hammer) the location is brilliant right next door to the 02 world we could actually walk there from where we were shower room right size, beds clean, tv channels, reception and eating area friendly and not to much. i will be back here very quickly if i were coming back again thanks for looking after us you were amazing!! frank colley xx

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: lkardatz
Reviews.Content: My great experience with Michelberger Hotel began when they allowed me to check in early after arriving in Berlin 5 hours before my boyfriend. I found the front desk staff to be young, friendly, knowledgeable and willing to help 24/7. Everything about the hotel was new, cool and well-designed, i.e. they played one of my favorite movies, "The Big Lebowski", on repeat on LCD flat screens in the hallways. Our room was spacious and unique. I enjoyed spending a few minutes exploring its quirks before crashing for a nap on the lofted double bed. The free wifi they offered me at check-in allowed me to track my boyfriend's flight and map a route to the airport to meet him on time. His feelings about the hotel were just as enthusiastic as mine. Although we did not have time to check out the bar/cafe next to the lobby, we did thoroughly enjoy the 9 euro breakfast each morning and let me tell you, it was worth every CENTIME!!! Hands down, the best hotel breakfast we've ever had. I love Michelberger, its staff AND the breakfast. I would definitely go here again and would suggest that you try it for the first time. Hell, I even bought a t-shirt!!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel of all the places I've been”
Reviews.Author: Sohannin
Reviews.Content: Already been here twice, once with wife and once with colleague. Excellent rooms, excellent attitude with personnel and extremely comfortable lounge - no matter what the time is. Travelling options to every direction in Berlin are great, stations to trains are near. Great bars and restaurants are close, the location is not as expensive as the central and western part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly and perfect”
Reviews.Author: jottavg
Reviews.Content: Everything is nice, inspiring, beautiful in Michelberger The people, the rooms, the breakfast, the lobby, the atmosphere perfect perfect perfect, good beds, nice bathroom, good place to be perfect connection with all parts of city Berlin nice area only the music is a little bit loud when you sleep on the first floor directly above the lobby Family van de Voort

Reviews.Title: “Cool little hotel - great value and location”
Reviews.Author: swbucho
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Michelberger a few times now for both a city break and work purposes and i find it a great place to stay. Good value for a pretty cool hotel to base yourself out of for your explorations of Berlin - it has a chilled out lounge area with plenty of magazines and books to read plus a bar with a range of drinks and food - good for kicking back after a day on foot around the city. Rooms are v comfortable, tidy and nicely put together - small with the beds (intentionally) taking up most of the room which is fine given the time spent there! Overall has a very laid back and welcoming feel to it. Also does great breakfast if you want to pay a bit extra - buffet based in a lovely industrial breakfast room. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest place Ive ever stayed - didnt want to leave and will be coming back soon”
Reviews.Author: kingofkong
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for Valentines weekend. Its really easy to get to from the airport (35 mins away) and you cant miss the place with the huge neon sign outside it. Right by tram/train spot and also the Berlin Wall. The Friday night was buzzing inside with a live band playing, tv cameras and amazing cocktails. We got one of the loft rooms which were amazing - so cool, shelves of old,weird german science books, elevated bed, massive ceilings and windows - really unique style to the place. Breakfast - didnt go to the ajoinging restaurant because it was a continental breakfast buffet - looked lovely but wasnt our thing. Coffee,crossants and freshly squeezed orange juice in hotel cafe were amazing and really good value. All the staff are cool and really helpful - multi national mix of people... The hotel lobby and lounge are is chilled with couches,blankets etc to recline on. Last night there was a hotel guest signing impromptu with her mates on guitar and piano - it was fresh ! Couldnt reccomend this place more - didnt want to leave and i will be coming back with some mates asap Cool spot - unique - sound staff - amazing city !

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Berlin cool.”
Reviews.Author: erinisfunky
Reviews.Content: i had one of the most fun and carefree weekends of my life in Berlin and staying at Michelberger was a part of that. We had the courtyard facing "band" room for just 3 of us, plenty of space to hang and sleep comfortably. Berlin beckons but you can't help but linger in Michelberger's bohemian vibe. One of Berlin's famous photoautomat booths is left out the front door on the other end of the bridge. The East Side Gallery is to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young people”
Reviews.Author: mtbAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I really love the Michelberger hotel, I went there 2 times in one year! It really made our stay in Berlin nicer. The hotel is really nice looking, clean and has the best breakfast buffet EVER. 1 time I went with my boyfriend, and that was perfect, so I when I got back home I soon made plans to go again! The second time I went back with 3 girlfiriends. After a drive of 12 hours we arrived at the Michelberger in the evening to find out that they had overbooked the hotel and that we had to go to another hotel, because other people wanted to stay in the room one day longer!!! We made the reservation months ago! Why didn't they said to the other people that the room was already booked and that THEY had to go or had to wait untill we where there? SInce we had the terrible long drive we didn't want to go in discussion and we really wanted to come back anyway.....cause the nice stay of the last time was one of the reasons to come back again! The other hotel was really crap. It was a hostel with shared bathrooms, not nice looking rooms and not as nice looking hotel. So we were very very very dissapointed that we couldn't stay at the Michelberger have of our stay in Berlin. All we got is 1 free breakfast. Since I really like the atmosphere of the hotel we went back for that other night (and beacuse the other hotel was bad). I will go back again, cause of the looks and location. I just hope I just hope that next time I will get the room for all the days I reserved it. Or else it would me a big dissapointment, again and I think I wouldn't go back anymore. I am not sure whether it is a hotel for older people, I would more say that it is for young people. Couples or friend doesn't matter. I stayed in a room for 4 (the 1 night I we could stay) and it was wonderfull!!! The location is perfect, right in between Kreuzberg and Friedrichshain, so if you like those neighbourhoods, I would stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NastiaLarkina
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the Internet while surfing through sites with interesting outstanding design. Occasionally at the same time I planned my journey to Berlin. The hotel was really friendly and nice. I took the smallest room but it was nice and cosy and I loved the interior and the view from the window. Potato salad at the bar was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, great style and service”
Reviews.Author: vonienne
Reviews.Content: I loved the Michelberger Hotel. The staff was terrific, rooms very stylish and well thought out. I spent a lot of time just studying the clever little innovations in the room. The rest of the time I mostly spent in the great cafe downstairs. I really couldn't have asked for more; it is Berlin at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Top value for money - Artsy hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: troels_aagaard
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Small but fine rooms. A bit designer-chik but perfect for a short get away. Breakfast buffet is fantastic although it is 10€ ektra. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Really unique hotel at a bargain price in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ellzzer3000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a brilliant option for those who like something a bit different. The bar was great to hang out in with friendly staff and live music sometimes you get the feeling people just like hanging out here. We had a lovely homemade soup from the bar quite late when we arrived, there is a restaurant but we didn't use it.
