We had a loft room which we thought was a double but it's two single mattresses and duvets which is normal in Germany apparently. It wasn't a problem though. The room itself was great, roomy and very light because of the massive warehouse windows. The location is great as it's right next to both train lines and a tram stop is right outside. Overall we were surprised at the value of such a wicked hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and lively hotel in an awesome spot in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Annemi83
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at Michelberger Hotel and we recommend this hotel to everyone! Even though the COSY room was quite small, it was pretty, fun and the bed was so comfortable. The walls are a bit thin, but this did not disturb us at all! we had a room on the 2nd floor, facing O2 stadium and could also see a bit of East Side Gallery. Hotel lobby is so comfy and relaxing, great music and reasonably priced drinks. Breakfast was OK, if possible go out to Friedrichshain (Boxhagener Platz) and find yourself a brunch buffet, it's worth it! I also ordered the Liebhaber set as a surprise for my boyfriend, which was a beautiful set of fruit, brownies and Prosecco! a lovely beginning to our fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Michelberger Hotel in Berlin – funky hotel, friendly and helpful staff, interesting area”
Reviews.Author: wmlewis
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger Hotel in Berlin is quite a funky place in the former East Berlin, in both appearance and vibe, having been converted from an old factory. The reception area sits adjacent to the cafe and lounge area, which you have to walk through whenever you come into the hotel. Mostly this was ok, but every now and then when I just wanted to get to our room (and a winding path it was, too, to reach it), especially at night, I wished we didn’t have to go through this area. No a big deal though, especially since the people in the cafe and lounge area always seemed very chilled out. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and all in my experience spoke excellent English. We didn’t book our room with breakfast, but ate there pretty much every day of our stay because they were so good, and were very good value for money – it was a help-yourself buffet. The breakfast room itself, where they also held dinners sometimes, was really cool, with a few small stand-alone tables and large tables with long benches – there were views out to the S-Bahn station, and as an interesting people-watching area this proved to be quite good fun as part of the breakfast experience. The hotel is in an excellent and interesting area (e.g. close to the East Side Gallery), with lots of great places to eat and drink very near-by. It was also close to both U- and S-Bahn stations, and to the tram, so public transport was easy and convenient for going anywhere at all in Berlin. Possibly the only disadvantage of this versus a more central hotel was we were often reluctant to return there to chill out in the late afternoon before heading out again – not a big deal though. We had a 12 night stay in one of the loft rooms (ours was room 111), which was close ground level with a view of the courtyard. At first I thought this would be a problem from a noise perspective, but this proved unfounded. It was a very quiet room, even when there was music in the cafe and lounge area. We didn’t end up hanging out in the cafe/lounge much, but the events they had seemed to include cool music and chilled people. It was a very mixed crowd of people staying at the hotel, too, which was nice. From quite young and hip travellers to older equally hip folks – a nice menagerie of the world’s groovy travellers. There was free wi-fi with a password, too. Highly recommended place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, individual with bucketloads of cool!”
Reviews.Author: cubalibre10
Reviews.Content: Michelberger has a pretty immense website, and it sets the scene for the hotel itself - zany, individual and very funky. The staff were so friendly and really helpful, location was awesome - near some great bars, the east-side gallery and the train/tube stations. Most of all the atmosphere created by the hotel makes it a friendly, relaxed and cool place to be - if you want to stay somewhere really different but with luxury and quality Michelberger is where it is at!

Reviews.Title: “For what it is and aspires to be, this is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PattyTPerth
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is squarely aimed at a younger, cooler clientele and so those of us who are no longer quite so young or cool might struggle with things like the pumping music in the lobby and loft beds. That said, the quality of service is very good indeed, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts are amazing. The way the rooms are set up probably makes this hotel unsuitable for the very young or the very elderly but I would recommend it to everyone in between as a fun and different hotel experience in a good Berlin location.

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you are part of something cool here...”
Reviews.Author: DawnR68
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed in a cozy room, which was small, but very smartly and efficiently decorated. The bed was warm and very comfortalbe and the shower was fantastic; hot with great pressure. The place may not be for people seeking traditional hotel comfort or luxury, but for me it was fantastic. I enjoyed the clean lines, high ceilings and industrial feel. The whole place is very designy and a lot of attention has been paid to every detail, which for me was fun and interesting... The breakfast buffet was wonderful and hanging in the bar/lounge was really enjoyable and relaxing. The music is very well chosen and one night there was a really good indie rock band playing live. My experience with the staff was that they were welcoming, kind and helpful. It's hipstery here for sure, but not cloyingly so. Staff members seemed to sincerely want to take good care of all patrons and they were very professional. LOVED the area too...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, very laid back”
Reviews.Author: Meally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Michelberger with friends on a stag night in early November. It's very easy to get to with an S-Bahn and U-Bahn stop just across the street. The staff are really friendly and very helpful. They were a little disorganised when it came to checking us in to our rooms but that was the only negative I can think of. The staff in the bar and at reception were great for organising taxis and giving advice on places to go. We were in a dorm-style room which was very tidy and spacious. The breakfast was good in the mornings and the beds were comfortable. There's a really good atmosphere in the bar/lobby of the hotel. Definitely a good place to explore Berlin from.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel that my college aged kids loved.”
Reviews.Author: sneezytennis
Reviews.Content: Location was a bit far away from sights, but U and S bahn stations are right across the street. Staff recommended Rio Grange restaurant nearby which was very good. Also good falafel place right next door. Had a drink in the hotel bar one night, which always seemed to have lots of patrons there. Funky, edgy design of hotel lobby, rooms, etc. We had a loft room which was fine for mom and 2 college aged kids.Could use better light. Staff was hit or miss....some were very friendly and helpful, others didn't seem to want to be bothered or have the time for questions. Thin walls....couple next door kept me up one night, which was awful. Didn't eat hotel breakfast. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “So Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: descoubes
Reviews.Content: excellent design, warm and courteous welcome, remarkable breakfast, very good east-Berlin location... what else do you need? you may just end up spending a large part of your stay in that hotel, from the bar to your room to the restaurant, and on again!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERTROOPERDECOOLHOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DafneK
Reviews.Content: i love the michelberger and berlin!!! it is such a hip hotel, when i go to berlin, i would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel but lacks some comforts....”
Reviews.Author: consan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and LOVED the look and feel of the hotel - very cool and funky. BUT even though we paid (in full, in advance) over the odds for rooms - €80 for single, €90 for double, which was the cheapest we could find; they had GIVEN away one of the rooms because we hadn't told them we'd be late. We were furious but they did offer a room with shared facilities for €40 instead which had to do for one night. We had bked separately but they mixed up the reservations for the whole weekend, who was checking out when etc. In our room, arriving at 11pm the windows were wide open and the room freezing cold and no heating working. For this, we got free breakfast (amazing selection) the next day and the heating was repaired by the next evening. Our friends heating never worked. Painful stuff. Staff were lovely and friendly though so you couldn't get angry with them....really. Hairdryers at reception, no phones in rooms which are very minimalist but stylish. We discovered we were in the cool part of town on the last night - previously we had partied in Orangieburger (??) area of town. then a girl there said go to Warscheur Strasse area and the Simon Dach Strasse, which is just up the road from the hotel! Very Shoreditch ( London) and up and coming. Found fab restaurants and bars there, very reasonable. Had a great night out there! So for all the hassles in the hotel, we would still recommend because it looks fab, is comfy, great breakfasts, lovely staff........but check your room in advance and tell them to close the window if you're staying in winter! Loved Berlin and it's people although it was completely lacking in the expected German efficiency - everything was delayed or late. It felt like Berlin moved to it's own tune and we loved that. Amazing bars to suit all tastes, great graffiti, funky art galleries and shops.

Reviews.Title: “hip hospitality at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: theholidaygirl
Reviews.Content: Michelberger is a stylish, friendly, comfortable place to stay in East Berlin. It's also an excellent value - we paid only €70 a night for our loft room. Despite its reputation as a party hotel, it wasn't noisy & we got excellent sleep. Rooms are funky & designed in a way that they feel like little apartments - spacious & light-filled. Lots of fun little details, too. Do they always show the Big Lebowski on TV in the hall? The breakfast, while a tad pricey by Berlin standards, was delicious & extensive. Its proximity to U-Bahn, S-Bahn & the trams made it really easy to get around the city. That said, there's not much to walk to (besides Karaoke, the East Side Gallery & some food stands) near the hotel. The area is a bit industrial, but it's not deserted (lots of foot traffic to the stations) . More by way of sundries would only improve the experience at the hotel, but the lack of them isn't a deterrent. We'll definitely stay here again the next time we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lostmywalletagain
Reviews.Content: I loved the cafe. It had great service, light food and outstanding coffee drinks. It was really a nice place to hang out while around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, homely stay in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: CardiffKid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the warchauer strasse station in east Berlin, a youthful part of the city. It's in a good location with two main train and underground stations a stone's throw away. There is also a collection of some good places to eat and drink if you don't want to go far. Positives: The reception and cafe area is great, big loungy rooms with blocks of books. Nice place to have a night cap after returning from an evening out (As we were checking out, some live music was on) Free fast wifi The rooms are cosy, stylish and clean. They play the Big Lebowski on tv screens on every floor, so you can always catch glimpses of this great film at every opportunity Friendly and helpful staff Negatives My room, for some reason, had a window into the shower. Not a complaint but just a bit disconcerting depending on whom you sharing a room with! The breakfast was nice but at €9, not cheap so you had to eat yours moneys' worth.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much a hotel, more an upmarket hall of residence”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was really looking forward to my 4 nights at the Michelberger and, in some ways, I'm pleased that I went. First, the good stuff: great location for public transport and the O2; friendly staff; "cool" atmosphere; good bar; excellent breakfast; clean and well renovated rooms (it's in an old factory building built around a central courtyard) with comfortable bed; free wi-fi throughout. However, I really think prospective guests should be aware of several points: the bar and ground floor sitting area reminded me of a Students Union bar particularly later in the evening, whilst the breakfast room with its long trestle tables and non-matching chairs reminded me of a refectory (albeit that the breakfast itself was, as I said, excellent). Now the not so good bits: reception is chaotic; no porterage; there is one smallish, slow lift serving 119 bedrooms on 5 floors; my room was tiny - no desk and chair (no chair at all); no wardrobe (just 3 hooks on the wall with 2 coat hangers); no airconditioning; no business facilities whatsoever; no fitness facilities. Would I go back? For a weekend with my wife or a concert at the O2 - definitely yes. For business - sorry but no.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: jess3416
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Cool bar and lounge area, cute, clean and comfortable rooms with attention to detail, great breakfast in the morning. Just down the street from the East Side Gallery. Next time I go to Berlin I'll be staying here for sure. We had a room on the street side which could be a bit loud in the day with the windows open and the rooms would get warm from the sun with the windows closed, but we didn't spend much time in our room during the day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, quirky, great location and the real Berlin experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelKitteh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Michelberger Hotel for two days in August at the start of a 3 week trip around Europe by rail. We were recommended to the hotel by a friend and were delighted to find it. The hotel's interior is funky, full of unique furniture and accessories, with hundreds of books around comfy chairs and sofas, lampshades made from magazines, guitars in corners for guests to use as they wish and a great court yard for warm weather. The rooms are quite quirky too - we booked a band room for four people and had a great upstairs area with netting to stop you falling out of bed! The whole place had a great 'Berlin buzz' about it and we ended up finishing our nights out with a bottle of wine in the bar which has a great chilled out ambience and which seems to be frequented by locals as wells as musicians, artists and dancers as they travel. Very convenient for tube and overground trains too and an easy 5-10 min train journey to central Berlin. We also walked one day and it only took about 30-40 mins. There are also some great restaurants and bars 10 mins walk away and reception will be happy to recommended them for you. They also have a very cute dog! Big thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary.”
Reviews.Author: Morning_blossom
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay. The architecture, the way they put furniture in the room...everything was very unusual. It is worth just to go there and see it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel-not only is it...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGG
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel-not only is it in a great location but it's full of friendly staff, quirky decor & excellent value for money. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “definitely the coolest hotel i've stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: chillychillies
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is such a cool place. Fab rooms and really well designed with a deconstructed warehouse feel, lo-fi and modern but also feels incredibly comfortable. We had an awesome room with a mezzanine style raised bed, all the rooms look amazing - check out the pics on the website. We didn't make it for breakfast but did squeeze in a couple of cocktails in the bar which were lovely. The location is brilliant, close to some awesome bars & clubs, short walk to east side gallery and the river and friedrichshain is a really nice area with cafe's, bars, cool shops and a fab flea market on a sunday. It's also just across the road from the metro station and trams & easy to get to from the airport. All that said, what really makes it is the people, they're so friendly, helpful and welcoming, you leave feeling like a friend. We were lucky to be there for the first birthday and invited to a brilliant party out in the courtyard.......literally didn't want to leave, we were even considering changing our flights! We'll definitely be going back and recommending to friends. THIS HOTEL ROCKS!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all-rounder”
Reviews.Author: tgord
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, but ultra comfortable, a lobby and courtyard where you would actually want to spend time and relax. Great rooms, we read many reviews that said the hotel was too hot, I stayed in 31oC temperatures and was fine. it doesn't have air conditioning, but fans were supplied which made it fine. Most of the rooms don't face the road, and have huge windows which open completely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NBlick
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is the most characterful hotel I've ever stayed in. A boutique style hotel near the east side gallery, easy to get to the centre of Berlin and airports (u-bahn opposite) The staff were very friendly and helpful, and frankly I could have happily stayed in the hotel all day. There are various 'themed' rooms, we had the mezzanine level with 'goal posts' to stop you falling out of bed! The coffee shop/bar in the hotel is reasonably priced. in an amazing setting. I will absolutely stay there again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and food quality stay in a courtyard facing room”
Reviews.Author: Seraphina_82
Reviews.Content: This is the most unique hotel I have stayed in. If you are sick of boring cardboard cutout hotels that all look the same, or hotels that look like their target market age is about 60, go to the Michelberger. The unique touches aside from the funky loft layout included second hand books throughout the hotel and made into lampshades, the chopping board breaky tokens, the witty way they provide written info i.e the 'do not disturb' sign. We were originally given a road facing room and it was noisy so we immediately went back to ask for a courtyard room and in this room we had a beautifully quiet sleep. It was easy to get to the city centre by train. I will say that some sheer curtains for daytime (there was only a blockout set) and a full length mirror would have made my stay 100% perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Funky low key hotel with comfortable rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: nikatik
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is a supercool stay for the young and hip who would like an inexpensive yet comfortable stay. There is a very cool bar, library and outside courtyard and have a mean breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place, Cool Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mushy79
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin with a large group of mates for a long weekend. The hotel is a modern warehouse style hotel. It has a great location right next to a station and lots of pubs and restaurants near by. The rooms were spacious, clean and funky. The staff were also helpful and friendly. Sitting out in the courtyard in the sun drinking a cold German beer was amazing. Would recommend this to any younger groups who want to stay in a cool hotel that won’t break the bank. I have to say Berlin is an amazing place and the people were all so friendly and would highly recommend it for a city break. Thanks again to the Michelberger for helping us have an amazing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cfiakka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, very artistic in its interiors and the staff there was really cool !!! The location was also spot on as we could be everywhere in just a few stops, and the S-Bahn station (Warschauer Strasse) is conveniently just opposite the hotel! The area is also interesting if you go up the road towards the station with little nice restaurants and cool shops! The only minus which wasn't that big of a deal was the actual cleanness of the rooms! But you could always complain if you have a problem! Overall very excited with this hotel and will definitely go back soon! ps: if you are looking for a hotel with a real pampering this is NOT your hotel! But if you are like us that just appreciate simpler things with tasteful looks and approach this is just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Caridi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay not only for it's great location, but the staff are also excellent. I stayed in the loft room with the double bed on the second level and it was great. I will definitely stay there on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sugarplum85
Reviews.Content: Okay, I have read some of the other reviews before posting my own, so here goes. I went to Berlin for a week's holiday and booked this hotel through Expedia, having read other positive reviews and seen some photos I decided this was the hotel for me. My room was small but perfect, with even the basic room having big beds (queen/king, I can't remember which) as well as a TV, wet room with great shower, and a fan. Honestly I don't understand why people are complaining about the lack of air conditioning. This is Berlin, Germany. The heatwave was a one off, maybe if you were in a year-round warm country you would expect A/C but not in Europe! Also this hotel isn't 5-star, so if all inclusive breakfast is what you want, you're looking in the wrong place. My only gripe - and this is very minor - is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, I only say this as even the cheapest budget hotels provide this facility in the room. Otherwise for me, the room was great and I really loved all the little details, from the rope towel racks, to the cute colourful coat hangers, the sepia photos on the walls - and who could forget the funny Michelberger labels on everything. Very fun! The location of the hotel is ideal. I knew I didn't want to stay right in the centre of Berlin so chose this location. As others have said, the Warschauer Strasse U-Bahn and S-Bahn station is right across the road, with all lines stopping there. A short walk away is a Lidl, Kaiser supermarket, the East Side Gallery, and lots of highly recommended cafes and restaurants. Step out of the door of the hotel and walk left, about a minute later you'll discover an amazing falafel place, Momo Falafel, where you can get a pita bread or box of falafel and help yourself to the accompanying salads and sauces for just 3-4 euro. Perfect for when you don't feel like venturing far! Breakfast was great and at €9 I was expecting great things - I needn't have worried. Plenty of fresh fruit, muesli, homemade breads, meat, smoked salmon, croissants, jams, butter, fresh coffee and tea, eggs - all sorts of yummy stuff to help yourself too. I think I had breakfast at the hotel nearly every day of my stay! The staff were always really helpful, never rude, and the only time I had to wait to be seen was if they were speaking to another guest, or on the phone. Yes, the hotel does focus on the kitsch and quirky side of things - but that's the point! To have somewhere a little different, informal, doesn't take itself too seriously. During my stay I saw other guests of all ages, couples, solo travellers, students, businessmen - it just goes to show that this hotel can suit everyone. Often I would just go downstairs to the bar/lounge area just to read, grab a drink and a slice of cake, and relax somewhere outside of my room. The bar is also well stocked, with hot and cold drinks at reasonable prices and strongly mixed! For anyone who's a fan of the Big Lebowski, try the Michelberger's 'The Dude' cocktail :) Mostly, I loved the fact that you could just wander around the hotel, take pictures, or do whatever you wanted without feeling like you weren't allowed to explore. My advice to anyone staying here is, take this hotel for what it is - a budget but fun, comfortable and quirky hotel in a great area of Berlin. Tschuss Michelberger, I hope to return soon! :)

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Minttuinen
Reviews.Content: We chose the Michelberger hotel based on great reviews. We stayed there for 7 nights, and started to notice that everything wasn't so great after all. At first the hotel was just like described, very cool, nice details and also the room (loft room) was very cosy. The hotel is near public transportation, u-bahn, s-bahn and tram. So very easy to get to and also in an interesting part of town. But. ..First of all, the room was cleaned properly only the first two days of our stay. The next days it was bearly cleaned at all - beds were not made, floor wasn't cleaned, or table tops. They seemed to only take out the trash from the small carbage bin. There was dust everywhere from the street because we had to keep the window open, due to the fact that there was no aircon. Towels were not changed until asked. Not that they have to be changed every day, but during a week you would think so. We told the reception about this, and no change in the cleaning. About the staff - they seemed quite nice, but you would always have to wait a long time before they had time for you. Sometimes there were three staff members kind of there, near the reception - but only one to serve the customers. They didn't seem to be very professional, a bit too much hanging out and not doing there job. I had the feeling that I was bothering them if I had a question. They did not do anything about the cleaning in our room - I didn't think they took it seriously. We checked out in the evening because we had a really early morning flight, and had to do it through very loud music as there was a band playing in the lobby. The desk could be in a different place - so that the music wouldn't disturb talking to the staff at the reception. Also music from the bands in the lobby (almost every evening) was too loud (could hear it clearly to the room) and disturbed our sleep as the music went on until at least twelve in the night. So - I would recommend this hotel only for a short visit, and only if you care more about a trendy and cool atmosphere than the service of a hotel. They have put much more effort into the atmosphere than the fact that it is supposed to be a hotel - not a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: stub0612
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in unusaully hot weather and seeing as there was no air con the rooms were unbarearbly hot, they had run out or fans and so did not sleep at all well. The loft rooms are the ones to get and at €90 good value, the bar was great, atmosphere ok, all be it a bit too try hard with people trying to be cool for no aparrent reason, overall ok and i am sure that if went at a differnt time of year then may be ok but I am afraid this Uber trendy place needs to stop trying so hard and get their basic services sorted out, also the staff seem to act as if they are guests, you can not work out who works there and if you can get them off their phones you could get them to help. no phones in the rooms and the lift was not working so all in all a chore and hotels are not supposed to be a chore. I left a day early as i could not bare to be there another night!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: CliffCo
Reviews.Content: I chose the Michelberger because of the great reviews on TripAdvisor. On the plus side, it is in an interesting side of town and there are some great restaurants around. It is also close to trains, trams and buses. Too close in fact. At night we couldn't open our windows because of the noise of cars, trains, trams and pedestrians outside. But, because it was quite hot and humid in the rooms (due to no circulation), we had to make the choice of either getting some air or sleeping. I agree with an earlier review that said the staff were not particularly helpful. They weren't unfriendly, just a bit disinterested. The biggest issue I had was I reported a (very) noisy fan in the bathroom on my way out one morning, and asked for it to be fixed that day. That night (around midnight) the fan started a loud thumping noise meaning sleep was impossible. I reported it to reception who made an effort to fix it without success and who couldn't answer why it hadn't been done during the day. In the end I opened the window because the street noise was preferable to fan noise! I know things can go wrong with anything, but their lack of effort to fix it when it was reported much earlier is what annoyed me most. The place has potential but needs a big attitude shift.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty Place, Good Location; Hangover Nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: Toddworth
Reviews.Content: We chose Michelberger as a swanky, young, and hopefully fun place to stay while in Berlin on our honeymoon. Very easy to get to as it's right across the street from two bustling U and S-Bahn lines, one of which (the U1) runs through Kreutzberg (like Berlin's Brooklyn) and many of the decent and un-touristy places to eat and hang out while there. When we arrived we were amused and impressed with the decor and the small touches of kitsch everywhere (ie. the old vinyl-framed b&w photos of random people). The beds in the upstairs loft seemed pretty comfy, and the shower was nice. Cool layout and great utilization of space. Stylish and unique above all else. So, we took advantage of the locale and went out to some great clubs and bars each night of our stay. Michelberger is across the river from Watergate and around the corner from Berghain. The loft was sweltering each night or morning when we came to bed despite having a fan blowing right on us, and neither of us had a good night's sleep for the time we spent in Berlin. There's no ventilation at all. Even worse, napping during the day was way out of the question because of the roar of traffic below; our options were to roast like turkeys in a quiet room with the windows closed or deal with the noise and try to get some sort of air flowing with open windows. It's paradoxical in a way--this is a place where a lot of partygoers flock to, yet a terrible place to sleep off a hangover. It is not the staff's fault that there was a heat wave while we were there, nor is it their fault that a torrent of endless and cacophonous traffic rolls by here twenty-four hours a day. We appreciated the unique vibe this place has to offer, but we simply couldn't sleep a wink while staying here. We paid around e80/$100 a night for no amenities besides hipness and lo-fi appearance. In a city with 600+ places to stay, you can find something better for this price. Despite all of this, I'm happy to have given it a whirl because it was quite different from anywhere else I've stayed. I could see this place being cosy if the conditions were right. For us, though, they weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Hippest hotel in town or maybe even the world”
Reviews.Author: Virginifer
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The whole concept of the place is AMAZING. It was the little touches we loved about this place: Big Lebowski playing in the corridors; little wooden tokens for breakfast; door key designed like a credit card. Rooms are great. We had a loft. There was a little noise and there is no aircon as they are minimising their carbon footprint. Other than that, we loved everything about the place. Free wifi. Breakfast is good. Bar and beer garden gets a lot of locals in and has a great feel to it. Location in East Berlin is the best place to stay we think. Room rates are great. Upgrade to a loft if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but an issue with the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: paroncider
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with this hotel, from the funky decor and friendly service to being a stone's throw from the s-bahn. It has a great vibe, and is ideally situated for exploring the nightlife of Berlin, as a few clubs were just across the street by the s-bahn station. The hiccup we encountered was being overcharged for breakfasts. Our group of four stayed three nights, and only ate breakfast downstairs once. Unfortunately the breakfast system is a bit flawed, as you collect a token from the front desk and hand it to the woman at the counter in the dining room. Somehow, something went horribly wrong and we were charged for something ridiculous like 16 breakfasts, when our group only ate downstairs once (breakfast x4)! We were only told of this error on checking out and unfortunately the hotel didn't believe us. We had to barter down and had to settle at paying for eight breakfasts, which was still disappointing that the hotel staff didn't believe us. If I recommend Michelberger to friends, I'll suggest they avoid breakfast altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Michelberger ist sehr gut!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleFoxglove
Reviews.Content: A cool, quirky hotel in East Berlin which I would recommend whole-heartedly. It has lovely bar, a seating area full of books, musical instruments, and lampshades made out of magazines, and a outdoor area which regularly has live music, and while I was there, had big screen TV's for the world cup. The atmosphere is great, and the location is perfect, just across the road from the train station and underground. A minute's walk away is a lovely bakery with an assortment of pastries for breakfast, which also serves coffee, and obviously the inevitable sausages! The hotel also offers the oppertunity to take an alternative tour of Berlin, with no cost apart from whatever tip you wish to give. This tour takes you to the bits of Berlin which you won't find in many tourist guides, but are extremely interesting in giving a taste of the 'real' Berlin. The showers have a see through window, so perhaps if you are not much of an exhibitionist and enjoy your privacy, that might put you off! However, me and my friend were fine and just agreed not to look! Rooms come with a bathroom, sink, and TV and are cleaned everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: resemannen
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger hotel is very easy to get to thanks to it's great location: right outside the hotel you can choose to go with the S-bahn, U-bahn or take the tram into the city. The room we stayed in (Cosy) was had a really cool design and there were plenty of funny little details. However, the room didn't feel very clean: there were stains on the floor and on the walls and the room had a funky smell in it. On the day that we were leaving the hotel we also saw what looked like a pile of dump in the stairs to the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, great location, great vibe”
Reviews.Author: OirishOrstraylean
Reviews.Content: Great beds, great location, great vibe. We stayed in a loft room, very funky and imaginatively designed, with massive windows, a double loft bed, a day bed, a tiny bathroom (with a fab shower), TV and various unique touches - netting shelves, anyone? The staff were friendly and very helpful all around, from the bar man to those on reception. Great breakfast too... I miss it already, and we only left yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “A really funky hotel that gets you in the right mood to enjoy Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Dimitrivaz
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel just opened last September, and the young staff created this unique property by converting an old warehouse building. It really feels like an IKEA summer project completed by some recent college grads, but the whole idea works perfectly. It is located in a lively part of the former East Berlin, which has a run down look to it, with tons of young adults just hanging out day and night. Our daughter and her friend were intrigued by the atmosphere, and enjoyed the clubs which were close by. The rooms are spacious, and include all the amenities, but nothing more, and certainly would not be termed luxurious. Don't come here if that is what you need in a hotel. Stay here if you want to try something a little wild, don't mind hanging out in comfy chairs in the lobby, or conversing with other young travelers in the courtyard. We had a blast, and the girls said it was their favorite hotel in the whole trip. Free wifi and paid on site parking were available.

Reviews.Title: “Love the super-efficient single room”
Reviews.Author: TrinityNYC301
Reviews.Content: After booking at the Michelberger, I was concerned I would be the only person over 35 in the hotel. I wasn't though it definitely skews young. I was also concerned it was too far east, but I loved the location. Very convenient to transportation and right by a fantastic bridge. The staff was helpful and friendly and i LOVED my little room. I live in a studio in New York, so I appreciated the efficiency of the room and the very high ceilings. I did not have breakfast there as i was still jet lagged but the breakfast/diing room looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kathym530
Reviews.Content: I can't add much more to the previous reviews. We picked based upon Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. And even though we are not as hip as the hotel, we felt welcome and comfortable. I loved the common spaces and spent a wonderful early morning in the patio, at breakfast (which was fantastic) and in the sitting area...great spaces to read, write, listen to music and relax. Our needs were anticipated and the staff was friendly and helpful even for the stupid questions..like how do you turn on the lights (with the key) and now that you've told me (again) can I have another key cause I left mine in the room. Room was comfortable and very green....a very smart hotel. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel: relaxed, original and quirky with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Trainspotter22
Reviews.Content: I spent three wonderful nights at the Michelberger Hotel. It is like staying in your own loft studio in Berlin with the best cafe/bar downstairs. The staff are on the ball, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are quite minimal but well considered. They have got the important things right - sound proofing, good quality mattresses and linen, ventilation, high ceilings, curtains that work - and have not wasted money on horrible hotel furniture (let's face it, even in 5 star hotels it is mostly not 5 star design), mini bars etc. You get a bottle of water and there is some pleasant hair and body wash in the bathroom. No wasteful little bottles. If you like your souvenirs you can keep your room key. Rarely have I stayed somewhere that I actually wanted to hang out in the bar or lobby but there was always a really chilled atmosphere, day and night. Breakfast is highly recommended and a bargain. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest hotels I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Alegitana
Reviews.Content: Modern, trendy, cosy, creative...I could spend my time giving lots of adjectives to this hotel. I've stayed there for one week, during a hard winter, and I could not imagine a better place to stay. Very nice rooms (stayed in a loft one), DELICIOUS breakfast (9 euros), great and cool bar (handsome barmans!!!), alternative neighborhood, next to some of the best nightclubs in town, very nice STAFF! I'd like to come back in summer. Maybe next year!

Reviews.Title: “Left the hotel yesterday, can't wait to go back there!”
Reviews.Author: Mia_Paris_75
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel thanks to tripadvisor and I couldn't be more satisfied with my choice. The rooms are simple yet hype and cosy and the atmosphere of the hotel is great. We stayed 4 nights and really had a chance to enjoy our rooms and the beautiful lobby. The staff is nice and helpful and even advised me when I was looking for a vegetarian restaurant near the hotel. Stupid tips : the wifi code changes every day so you have to ask to the reception for a new code every day the bar is open all night and they have some very good stuff (japanese whiskey, 15years old rhum and cocktails...) when you enter your room for the first time, you have to know that to activate electricity, you have to put your key room in a slot just after entering (left side when you enter) if you have your breakfast at the hotel, try to have it before 10am, you'll have more choice at the buffet. And believe me, it worth it. I'll definitly come back, with more friends !!

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool hotel - without being pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Cleo_O
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger would not be out of place in trendy Shoreditch or Hoxton in London with its cool warehouse/industrial interior and exposed lighting wiring, a hotchpotch of differemt bar chairs and huge sofas to slump into. The lounge is sublimely relaxing with racks of books, a grand piano and acoustic guitars which are occasionally played well (by residents or official musicians, I dont know!) and there's a great playlist of music in the bar segueing effortlessly from rock, pop to country to classical. The bar serves probably the best coffee in Berlin and some very decent cocktails too. Breakfast is a relaxed buffet affair set in a separate room with long refectory tables and a delicious organic range of breakfast items such as salmon, eggs, cold cuts, juices, coffees and teas, breads and cereals and fruit and veg, at 9 euros per person. Snacks are available all day in the bar at a reasonable price and are of great quality. Service is charming, welcoming, friendly, efficient and super-helpful. Bedrooms are set around a large courtyard, home to smokers, bicycles and some tables for warmer climes. The cosy Room does just what it says on the tin; its compact and ship cabin like, with not much storage or hanging space. The rooms are simply decorated, with humorous touches (altermative Do Not Disturb door sign is a classic example). Even though the rooms are small, they are all surprisingly airy and bright, the double bed is large and super comfortable, and the shower hot and powerful, and everything is spotless. The hotel is right opposite the U1 line that runs east to west and there's a tram service too. Check out Simon Dach Strasse - 5 minutes walk away for a wonderful array of well priced restaurants and bars, and the East Side Gallery on the wall by the river. In short the Michelberger is a fantastic option and I wouldnt hesitate to book it for my next trip. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scribalicious
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel the last two times I have been to Berlin and have also recommended it to my friends who loved it. I love it. Perfect Location, Friendly Staff, great price. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed modern, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maccamarie
Reviews.Content: The minute I walked into the Michelberger I wanted to live there - cuckoo clocks, vintage suitcases, fresh flowers, grand piano, walls of books - it is immaculately designed, down to every last detail. The staff were friendly and helpful. They were able to accomodate us for an extra night following the volcano fiasco, and we were able to borrow a laptop to check our travel situation. The room was basic (bed, bathroom, tv) but cosy, clean and modern and good value for money at 60 Euros a night. Breakfast at 9 Euros was an all you can eat feast and served until a leisurely 11 o clock. The hotel is easy to get to - on the s bahn, u bahn and tram routes. And there are lots of cafes, bars and restaurants in walking distance. My only criticism was that there was a lot of noise from the bar and outdoor area on the Saturday night until the early hours, and if I was a lighter sleeper this might have disturbed me. All in all though, if I go back to Berlin I would definitely book the Michelberger hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A excellent hotel and a charming staff”
Reviews.Author: Jean_76_Paris
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who has stayed in this hotel during the Easter. From the first moment we could feel everything was perfect. There, we met Alex (one of the receptionists) who helped us in everything we need from the beginning till the last day. The best receptionist in the world! Thanks for everything Alex! The hotel's location is perfect because the stop of the U-bahn and S-bahn are 50 meters from the hotel. In addition, the neighborhood where it is located (Friedrichshain) is a very interesting neighborhood if you're a young person looking for a dynamic neighborhood with cultural activity. Every detail in the hotel is put carefully. The design is visible in every corner of the building and everything is taken care to ensure that tenants are comfortable. The bar area is located next to the reception and is an ideal place to chat, meet people, listen to the music, drink or use the internet. It is really quiet and cozy. The room where we stayed was the Loft. It is a large room where a big bed is housed at a height. There is a big table too, to put everything you need there, and there is also an extra bed with big cushions that you can use like a sofa. The windows facing the street were beautiful and the bathroom is clean but have little light. Another notable thing perhaps is the breakfast. For just 9 euros have a varied breakfast with various products of high quality. In addition, people who work there are very friendly. It's very recommendable to have a breakfast there! The most notable thing in the hotel was the people who work there. They are really helpful and friendly, and they have very good atmosphere! I think they really like what they do and you can feel it when you are there. In short, is an ideal choice for young and happy guests looking for a cozy place with excellent service. People doing this hotel are wonderful and have managed to create an almost perfect hotel. Do not hesitate to visit this hotel if you are going to visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JemThomas
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks all the boxes for a family with teenage kids. The Family rooms are just right and the price at 65EUR per night is spot on. You are right next to the U Bahn and Tram so getting around is easy. Freidrichshain is a hip area with lots of interesting places to eat. Don't let the odd web site put you off these guys have really put some thought into this place and have created a novel freshing place to stay. They do follow the Easy Jet model so you have to pay for all the extras, for example the breakfast is 9EUR but it is a really good spread so fill yer boots and if you're not hungry you don't have to partake. So if you are planning any sort of trip to Berlin STAY HERE you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and affordable hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: thefortuna
Reviews.Content: The service at the Michelberger was amazing. I was delayed and they let my partner check-in under my name easily. I got the single room and it was compact but very unique, free wireless, and a flatscreen TV. It had everything a young couple needed to start sightseeing in Berlin and beyond. The location is a two minute walk away from the train station. In a few stops you are at the heart of Berlin, and Potsdam is a short hop away. In one day we hit the Brandeburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, museums, looked at the river Spree, did some local dining, and rode the train back to the room and still had time to go for a drink downstairs at the wine bar/cafe and some conversation at the lounge. Very convenient. The location is absolutely the best part of this hotel. What I liked least was not having a phone in the room. I recommend bringing a laptop and using a Skype account. Problem solved.

Reviews.Title: “Basecamp for Berlin-Wildlife-Excursions”
Reviews.Author: kanoesel
Reviews.Content: I stayed a long time there.....this hotel is organic, its crowing more and more to a melting point for cool dudes and amazing women from all over the world. If you wanna stay in Berlin, take a hotel. If you wanna be alive in Berlin, take the michelbergerhotel ! "Heissa Safari, the walk on the berlin side starts here!!"

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, magical stay”
Reviews.Author: MariaGraziaZ
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, magical place. All the staff look after you, they are very kind and will make every effort to make you feel at home. You can have a coffee, a reviving herbal tea or a beautiful amazing cocktail; you can drink it in the lovely 50's themed lounge or in the cool courtyard or up in your room. The breakfast is delicious and you can pig out on the lovely cheeses and hams and pastries and the amazing home-made German breads. I only stayed for 4 days and wish I could have stayed a lot longer; the atmosphere on Friday and Saturday night was fantastic, with many people enjoying the lounge, the majority were probably not residents. The rooms are different from the rest, interesting, with personality and wit. Definitely not your average corporate hotel, I highly recommend the MIchelbergers' as they made me have a wonderful break... will come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin at it's best”
Reviews.Author: bschellenberg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great rooms. The hotel is ideally located near several public transportation options. It takes about 30 min from Tegel to the hotel. The lobby and rooms are funky, but very comfortable. We booked a loft room and slept like little kittens between the comfortable sheets and on a very great mattress. There is a small coffeeshop down the block and a large supermarket just over the bridge. There are also multiple kabob shops to choose from. We loved the various bars and clubs in the area.

Reviews.Title: “East Chic”
Reviews.Author: frozensausage
Reviews.Content: I spent my 31st birthday in the Michelberger, and the experience was fantastic. This has to be one of the best hotels in which I've ever stayed, yet didn't have a hefty price tag attached. The Michelberger is perfectly positioned across the road from the Berlin U and S Bahn, which makes it a great base to explore the city, although Friedrichshain itself is a really cool area whicgh I wouldn't have discovered had the hotel not been there. The hotel itself feels more like a trendy bar, yet the service and staff are friendly and efficient. The rooms themselves are scrupulously clean, and the room we had had a great view out onto Warschauer Strasse and the U Bahn. This has to be THE place to stay in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “A break from exhaustion: clean and quiet, coffee and funk”
Reviews.Author: greencateyes1
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Berlin after 10 hours of incredibly hectic transit and this hotel managed to deliver exactly what I needed: a clean and quiet room (two hours before their official check in time), an incredible breakfast, good coffee and some great music playing in their cafe/lounge area. The service was also incredible: the staff are friendly, young and incredibly competent. And even better, they are willing to help with any problem that you encounter (including lost luggage). I would highly recommend the Michelberger Hotel to any traveler. I should note though that the only downside of my stay was that the hotel is rather far away from the airport and, not knowing this, I ended up taking a 40 Euro ride upon arrival. I would recommend trying to take public transit if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a little pretentious”
Reviews.Author: pathologic_KT
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a hipster vibe to it. Everything, from the room access cards to the bar menus to the don't disturb signs has something quirky about it. It's a bit pretentious, but not offensively so. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and comfortable. My room was very small, which was not unexpected. It would've been great to have a chair in the room though. I found it quite difficult to sleep (disclaimer: I'm a light sleeper). My room faced onto the central courtyard, and every night smokers would gather in the courtyard and talk loudly. This happened all through the night, despite the rain and snow. It was frustrating. If you're a light sleeper, perhaps request a room on the other side of the corridor. The location is a bit out of the way, but it's well served by the U-bahn and S-bahn stops just down the road. If you're coming from the airport via public transport, I'd suggest the U-bahn, which is closer to the hotel and has fewer stairs to negotiate than the S-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Want to stay somewhere different, in a great location, at a great price...this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Aimsed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miichelberger for three nights and loved the whole experience of the place. There is a really cool vibe and the staff are super friendly and helpful. It is all very relaxed and personal. As I am pregnant we loved the fact that we could chill out in the bar area downstairs and not feel like we were in the way/out of place. Not to mention that drinks and food didn't cost over the odds. The neighbour was great, had a fab Indian in Amar not 5 minutes walk away in Kreuzberg. Transport network was brilliant...weather wasn't great so we really used the S-Bahn and U-Bahn alot. The room was very funky, maybe lacked a little in some of traditional hotel features you grow accustomed to (phone, safe, minibar) but we didn't really miss any of this stuff. If you like to stay somewhere with a bit of soul as opposed to the usual hotel lobby stiffness then this is the place for you. Good work Michelberger Team

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: parks82
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what others have said before me, this place is great! The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, and not to mention willing to stay up and talk crap with a bunch of drunkards! The rooms are designed in a really clever and neat way, we had 3 of the "band" rooms which have a large sleeping area up above the rest of the room and there was plenty of space for 4 of us. It's also fantastic value for money, boutique hotel style for hostel money and I will go back for sure. On a finishing point - the 4 Euro goulash is unbeatable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Berliney”
Reviews.Author: Elvine
Reviews.Content: This is Berlin in a nutshell: good value for your money, creative and tasteful. Rooms have mirrors hanging from ropes and the showers have a window to the room, so you can see and be seen (by your travel companion only...) It’s located by Warschauer Station, a very apt location for this industrial chic place. Oh, and the breakfast is mind-blowing!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool, relaxed and inspiring place. I can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: joebraidwood
Reviews.Content: I visited Michelberger after hearing great reviews from friends who had been there. This is usually a good sign - and it was. The hotel is an incredibly cool, relaxed and inspiring place. The interior design is outstanding, the location is fantastic and the staff are some of the most friendly and professional people I've ever had the please of being served by. I was there for just three nights and shared a loft room with two friends. We all slept very well and the room was great. The food at lunchtimes (when we got up after a night's partying) was exceptional in the hotel's outstanding and relaxed restaurant. But it was in the lobby/bar area where we really had the most fun, staying up until the small hours being served ice cold beers and chatting with the staff. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “An unconventional hotel near the convention center...that bespeaks Berlin ubercool”
Reviews.Author: JuddS
Reviews.Content: The Michelberger is a truly unique, very special experience - but it is not for everyone. The hotel's theme is "under construction" - and they play this out with spackle on the walls above a certain height. One does gets the feeling they might have just been too cheap to finish painting, but they manage to pull it off. The lobby and cafe are really confortable, and have the vibe of a chill cafe. Hipsters hung out all hours of the day and night, and the decor is created by rotating displays of bold art and piles and piles of random books. We stayed in three different rooms over three nights - we had booked a room for 3 people, but when we arrived they didn't have that room available. To their credit, they gave us two doubles for the price of one - but this still was not adequate as we wanted 3 individual beds, and 2 of us guys had to bunk together. The double-bed rooms are really small and only adequate for a close couple or single. The last two nights were better, as we had the "loft" room we originally reserved, which are a fantastic deal in this city. The hotel itself is clearly an old factory, and the rooms do have a very loft feel - I wish they did better with the appointments and toiletries, as these are a little on the cheap side. The hotel is really great for young people who don't need lots of service or luxuries - when we asked for bedding for the sofa/bed in the room, it was dumped off by the night watchman. We had to make the bed ourselves. I'm not looking for Ritz-Carlton service, but having to make my own bed in a hotel was a bit annoying. I grew to really like the location, but first impressions were that it was strange. It is located out on what feels like an overpass by a major convention center. The U-bahn line terminates across the street, but it is not the most useful line if you are trying to get to the center of Berlin. The S-bahn station is a bit of a walk through inhospitable industrial surroundings, but nothing unsafe or really far. It doesn't really feel urban - surrounded by rail yards and vacant lots, but somehow works with the place. The location is, however, very close to the hippest nabe in Berlin - Freidrichstein. Great restaurants, shops and cafes are really a 10-15 minute walk away. The location is kinda perfect for what must be the interests of their clientele. If you don't go expecting top service or a "normal" hotel, the Michelberger is truly a hipster find - this is not your typical boutique hotel or design hotel experience, but one that has rougher, edgier vibe that bespeaks uber cool Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel for tourists in Berlin; I will stay here on all future trips.”
Reviews.Author: BosTrav
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a great trip to Berlin, and represents a tremendous value. The location is ideal for exploring the hip neighborhood of Friedrichshain (and the East Side Gallery) on foot. To get to other parts of the city, the U-bhan and S-bahn are directly across the street -- this will end up saving you loads of money on cab fare. Even in the dead of winter, we used cabs only to/from the airport. For all other trips, the U-bahn, S-bahn and buses are the way to go. The public areas of the hotel are decorated well, especially the breakfast room. Speaking of which, the buffet breakfast could not have been more perfect -- and for only 9 Euros, it is a steal (especially if you eat as much as I do.) The rooms are very basic, but very comfortable. You have everything you need as a tourist in these rooms. The beds could not be more comfortable, and if you stay in a loft room as we did, you will not want to get out of bed because of the "cocoon" effect you experience on top of the loft. Also, our room was on the second floor and looked out onto the street facing the U-bahn but there was zero noise from the outside. Note: if you are a business traveler, this hotel might not be ideal for you. There are no fax machines (or telephones) in the room and there is no business center or fitness center. These are things I usually look for when traveling on business. Also, I do not think the location is ideal for business travelers who probably want to be closer to other areas of the city. I also do not think there are conference rooms available at the hotel for business meetings. The price cannot be beat. When staying in Berlin, I normally pay more than double what I paid to stay here. Yet I found myself wanting for nothing, and, in fact, enjoying my experience much more. Lastly, I want to comment on the service. On the morning of our checkout, we waited outside the breakfast room just before 7 a.m. when it opens. Because an employee was ill, there was only one staff member responsible for preparing the breakfast and setting it up on the buffet. She saw us waiting and opened the breakfast room a little early for us. She could not have been more friendly and apologetic for the fact that she needed a little extra time to get things completely ready due to being short-staffed. She put out items as they were ready and told us repeatedly (in perfect English) that if we needed anything we should ask her for it. Her apologies were totally unecessary as we understood that we were very early (we had to get to the airport to catch our flight) and despite being short-staffed she had the place under control. But her friendliness and concern were truly exceptional and is part of the reason why I would want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: BenZeto
Reviews.Content: How happy I am that I chose this hotel while hesitating with a cheaper solution !!! This is simply the hotel where you have to stay in Berlin. I spent 5 nights at MichelBerger around Xmas with a friend. The hotel was created by a group of friends and opened last July and is therefore spotless. The large chill out area is perfect to have a beer and exchange with other fellow travellers. Without talking about the super stylish deco and great music! It is very much a backpacker atmosphere with the comfort of a strong 3* hotel for a ridiculous price (€65 p.n. excl. breakfast). Took the breakfast twice (€9 p.p.) and didnt regret it (fresh fruits, cheese, croissants, eggs, etc.) The hotel is ideally located at Warschauer Strasse with the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and Tram all nearby. Points of interests like the East Side Gallery is only a 5min walk. Simon Dach Strasse with its tons of bars only 10min walk, and you basically reach any part of the city in less than 20min. Most important is the fantastic/fab staff ! Berlin was almost dead on Xmas eve and we were unable to find a restaurant open. They offered us to sit at their table with friends and family... never spent such a nice Xmas while abroad! So so welcoming! If you're looking for smtg outside of the box and/or 100% Berliner, that's the place where you want to stay! You definitely see me there next time I'll go to Berlin :)

Reviews.Title: “Very cool. Fantastic staff and atmosphere And LOVED their music!!”
Reviews.Author: LinnyPie
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay here,. it's quite Hoxton/New Yorky. Simple clean kooky rooms,. great music compilations in the bar, brilliant value for money, fab breakfast,. very beautiful and ridiculously helpful staff,. gorgeous dog! and very comfy chill out area. Also, it was situated in a great area, I would definitely go again, and would indeed highly recommend it. Its a perfect place to stay for a city break. They've got it SO right! Get a room at the back if you can,. the only downside to this place is it can be noisy at the front as its situated on a main road. I switched room to the court yard area which was very quiet. Also, there's no baths ,. only showers (apart from in the delux suite)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: VixPhilotes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply perfect. I had my reservations as when we booked there wasnt much to go on given how new it was. But as soon as we arrived it just felt comfortable and welcoming. From "the shining" inspired hallways to the quirky decorations, the spacious rooms and the friendly staff we couldnt fault the place. The bed was set above the rest of the room meaning we had so much space, plenty of quiet half hours lounging on the daybed. The location is really good, near the trendy locations in the East and lots of transport links. We had no problem getting all round town and back again. Only made breakfast once, but there was plenty to it and the large breakfast room had lots of charm. The lounge / bar was great. It felt so homely that you cant help but kick of your shoes and curl up on the couch whilst sipping your cocktail....until you suddnely realise its 3am and you should really go back to bed. We'll definitely be going back and I'm already recommending this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Berlin, stay at the Michelberger...”
Reviews.Author: Sheldinio
Reviews.Content: ...it's that simple, I've just got back to England from my three night stay in Berlin and the hotel proved a significant feature of my completely positive experience. My girlfriend had booked so I was aware that it was going to be a 'hip' budget hotel but could not have envisaged the ambience, the relaxed aesthetic that infuses everything about the place without ever comprimising on quality or value for money. The ground floor is welcoming, warm and stylish. There is a large lounge bar area that guests and non-guests lazily mingle throughout the day and night. The bar is well stocked - it has good quality and tasty food - and was tended by a quirky range of staff ranging from pretty young things to men in their fifties in strangely apt bow ties. I really liked it that the one quality that united the staff was friendliness and not age, looks or background. The room was an impressive design feat with a mezzanine floor holding the bed that faced a huge window overlooking the grafitti-strewn train line. It might not sound a huge aesthetic hit but then it depends what you like; I liked the quality of the room, the view showed me an undeniable aspect of the city I was in and it felt honest but stylish. The breakfast is fantastic value and was a real pleasure. For 9 euros they serve fresh breads, fruit, meats, cheeses, wonderful scrambled eggs, tasty coffee and the nicest jams I've had in a while. It makes a mockery of the breakfasts too often found in large corporate chain hotels. Finally, I guess I would say the staff were a significant aspect of our experience. They were friendly, clearly loving their jobs and part of something more than simply a business. The place has an ethos of relaxed but unwavering style, and it is delivered at a bargain basement price. If more hotels go this way then all the better for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept and value”
Reviews.Author: Annike
Reviews.Content: I had a three-day stay in Michelberger and was not disappointed at all. I agree with the traveller who mentioned that the hotel has a youth hostel vibe with a hotel comfort. Friendly staff who care to remember your first name and make sure that everything is alright (they extended my check-out time with no problem), a fantastic public area filled with books and sofas and cushions that invite you to spend some time there. I reserved the 33m room, which was perfectly arranged even for its small size, with large windows and a see-through wall dividing the bed area from the shower. Please note that the rooms have no toiletries nor phone. The great care for details is also shown in the rooms, I loved the design. For 59€ I found it of great value, and so is breakfast at 8€, which you cannot miss both for the quality and the magnificent room. Location is also very good - withing walking distance of the O2, the East Side Gallery and the cafes, bars, restaurants and shops of Friedrichshain. A tram stop is literally in front of the hotel, subway and s-bahn can be reached with a 2/5 minute walk.. and from there you can easily get to any place in and out Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, atmosphere and location. Small but beautful”
Reviews.Author: IronDuke555
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Super cool without being try hard or pretentious, ok the rooms aren't massive, but that's missing the point when it's such great value. The bar is perfect for a drink before you go out and the breakfast is super tasty, and robust enough to revive you enough the next day for a good days sightseeing. Great to go with your partner, or with a group of mates. Good location, it's just on the edge of an "up and coming" suburb with loads of good bars and restaurants. There is also the watergate club within a 5 min walk and the Panorama bar is only one u-bahn stop (or a long walk) away. Nothing more to say, go now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonDrg
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel in the Guardian, and it exceeded the positive expectations we got from reading the article. It is a trendy but relaxed place, with very friendly staff and a pleasant atmosphere. The rooms were small but comfortable and it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Nice People.”
Reviews.Author: Traveltubby
Reviews.Content: I'd have no hesitation in recommending the Michelberger, unless you're a fan of the corporate / bland hotel in which case you may have some issues! The hotel itself is quirky in design and layout, but it's clean, comfortable and in a great location opposite the S & U-Bahn stations. The room I had as a single traveller was small but well laid out and perfect for my needs as I was there to see the city. The bar /communal areas were good places to relax, and the hotel has the vibe of a youth hostel but the quality of a hotel . The best attribute however is the staff - they seem to hit the right balance (for me) between informality (welcoming, considerate and friendly) and yet remaining professional (serious about what they do, and their guests satisfaction.) Great Hotel - will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, breakfast to die for and great location”
Reviews.Author: LisaTSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Booked the Michelberger as it was near the O2 World not realising that when we got off the train wondering which way to go that out of the dark there is was glowing and only a 2 minute walk. The staff were really friendly and spoke brillant English. We hadn't booked for breakfast but I would definately recommed having it €8 for an all you can eat with great coffee. The rooms were great nice and clean and the showers were fantastic. Overall I would go back to the Michelberger and would highly recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “100 % satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Sluggo73
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt one of the best hotel experiences I've had in a long time. Very cool and clean rooms, great location and a super-friendly and helpful staff. The price for the room was more than fair and I'm more than happy to highly recommend the Michelberger Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Goulash, lampshades and rope cords!”
Reviews.Author: RobinHood024
Reviews.Content: Not a chain - thankfully - and if you're looking for Saga "comforts" then go somewhere else, but for two 50-somethings this was a great stay. Even though there was only two of us, we had a room that sleeps 5 with mezzanine so that my wife could throw socks at me from above! Excellent value- the room not the socks! Room fittings are a design feature - smartly whipped ends of braided cord support accessories and the lampshades in the bar/lounge are 'textbook' -really! music choice also very engaging. We were there before they started doing evening meals but the goulash soup with turkish bread was excellent value and the breakfasts, particularly the fresh breads, will keep you going all day. Very close to East Side Gallery and Oberbaumbrucke and as others have said transport access U & S-bahn is literally across the road. S3 from Hauptbahnhoff takes you door-to-door through the centre. Tip: Surprisingly, for a major western economy, the cash machines are few and far between, if and when they work, and we found ourselves in a restaurant that took cash only!

Reviews.Title: “A good start, room to improve”
Reviews.Author: crox40
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Michelberger based on a write up in the Guardian and overall we were happy with our decision. The hotel is cool and funky and definitely fits the neighborhood it is located in. They openly admit that they are in quite an ugly area of the city right on the sign out front but they make the best of it. The rooms were always clean and made up quite promptly - there were a few hangers for clothes and a small space to put your bags. The breakfast is pretty good and served until noon - a rarity with hotels so they are definitely aware their clientel spend their nights out late. On the down side, this late night habit of guests proved a bit of an issue. We give service 3/5 primarily because even though they were quite helpful when we spoke to them, there was only one person working the front desk even at busy times and it would be quite a wait to speak to them. And a bigger deal - at around 4am one night someone came back - obviously froma night out drinking and started pounding on a room door across the hall, yelling for someone to open up. This went on for quite a while and unfortunately there are no phones in rooms to call the front desk and our room was quite a distance from the front desk. The noise issue is the main reason for only 4 stars - the hotel backs onto a recycling destination and at 8am each morning but Sunday we had machines hard at work. Overall it was a great experience - lots of good bars and restaurants within a short walk and U & S Bahn connections plus a Tram right across the street. They were unable to locate our reservation which could have been a big problem on the big weekend but they seemed unworried and settled everything quite quickly. There is free wireless but you have to renew your password each day at the front desk. Definitely recommend this place - especially if you are planning a visit around an event at O2 World or want to visit places in Friedrichain. It is also a phenomenal value - €55 a night (bigger rooms for €65) though I did see someone who booked through another service for €50 so there is value to be had here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully chaotic weekend.”
Reviews.Author: ahl88
Reviews.Content: If their raucous opening weekend festivities are any indication of where this place is going, it's gonna be one chaotic and fun ride for our friends at the Michelberger. Common Areas: Great vibe -- the lobby seating area has plenty of obscure books and magazines to peruse, and the lampshades were constructed with old East German glossy magazines. And that's before you even reach the front desk. For some, the central focus of the common area is the small, pleasant cafe area, which serves the usual coffee drinks, sandwiches and the like. But more important for this weekend's festivities was the courtyard, which would be the scene of a tropical-themed 2-night kickoff party sponsored by Bacardi (or some other damn brain-pollutin' dark liquor that always bites at inopportune times). Generally speaking, my room was on the 1st floor, facing the courtyard where the band would be playing. More specifically, my window opened onto the stage. As in, I could lean out the window and nearly tap the bassist on the arm (I refrained from doing so). The lovely young lady at the front desk had explained that because of this weekend's festivities, "it might be quite loud at times." Woman don't tell no lie -- it rocked like a Blue Oyster Cult concert, circa 1978. (I can't find the umlaut on this computer.) Anyway -- No sleep, and I didn't care. With so many nightlife options in the area, the one (loudly) outside my door turned out being the best. Gotta love it when a plan comes together. Rooms: Small, functional, and economical. Paid about 62 Euro per night. That first shambolic weekend, the accommodations were still a work-in-progress -- on my 2nd night, the shower broke, and leaked water all over the floor. No harm, though. Handled with a smile. Service: Five stars. I'll be honest -- being from a more, say, "staid" part of the world -- I was fearful that the place would be infested with Annoying Hipster Douchebags (AHDs). Several of the artistes at the bar, who were clicking away on their MacBook Pros, raised my Douche Awareness Level to 4. And there were more potential AHDs near the front desk. Did they... work here? I should've calmed down. The staff, while undoubtedly dressing the part of the dissolute mid-20s slacker, were outstanding. Case in point: I mentioned that I forgot my razor, and the guy standing next to me disappeared, almost without saying goodbye. Five minutes later, he returns with a razor he bought at the local drug store. I could see he was out of breath, too -- he must have jogged there! In all my years staying in hotels, I've never seen anything quite that ... well, touching. Class move. (To return the favor, I picked up some power adapters at the electronics store in the mall at Alexander Platz. The staff thanked me way too much for this little housewarming gift.) Location: I grew to like Frederickshain, but all in all, like Prezlauer Burg a little bit better. The Hotel itself is right across the street from a main station. That is a good thing. Overall: Crazy, chaotic, cheap, fun and friendly. Great concept, and while it's still a work-in-progress, they appear to have an enthusiastic team. I'll definitely be back. However, if I'm there for another Friday night party, I'm bringing earplugs this time.

Reviews.Title: “If I could have made it, it would be like that”
Reviews.Author: LadyPek
Reviews.Content: Very well located in front of 2 U and S Bahn stations, almost along the Spree. Not completedly central but definitely a Berlin flavor. The hotel is very well designed, rooms are comfortable and very creative in the way they are furnished. The nicest parts are the breakfast room, the lounge and the bar where I would have stayed for hours. Last but not least, the team is great and they all give great advice to make the most of your trip to Berlin. I felt like I was staying with friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the funkiest places I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: nik001Sweden
Reviews.Content: First of all - check out their website at www.michelberger.com. The unusual layout of the website speaks for the hotel as a whole. This is really a funky hotel. Well worth the money, as it is not at all expensive (rates as low as €65 for a double room with a proper third extra bed, not a sofa). Even though the hotel has only been open about a month or so, the atmosphere is already a bit like staying at your best friends place and I am certain it will be more expensive to stay here in the future once the hotel has been open a few months. Location is brilliant. About 100 meters from the U1 (Warschauer Strasse) and another 3-400 meters to the S-Bahn which takes you out to Schönefeld Airport in 15 minutes. Trams and buses stop outside for connection with other tube lines and other cool parts of old East Berlin. However, if I am to give the room a few bad pointers they are: 1. The room type that we were staying in was defineatly not suitable for a person of larger size or with a disability as there are very narrow stairs leading up to the double bed. The whole room is built according to "compact living" ideals. If I think about it, you should propably not be too drunk either, as falling backwards might leave you permanently lodged into the flat screen TV on the wall behind you. 2. There is an in-wall light installed by the lower right side of the toilet that gets seriously hot. Risk of getting burnt. 3. Not a single English speaking TV-channel which could cause some distress for someone who doesn't speak German. However, if you are so dull that you spend a weekend in Berlin watching telly, you are mad!! I will certainly stay at this hotel again in the near future!!
